shall_sentence:
The completed checklist shall be 
uploaded and available 
at: https://github.com/opencomputeproject/OpenSystemFirmware/[vendor_name]/[product_name]/.
before_shall:
All products seeking OCP Accepted™ Product Recognition must complete the Open System Firmware (OSF) Tab in 
the OCP Open Platform Firmware 2021 Supplier Requirements Checklist.
after_shall: Note to author:  replace [vendor_name] and [product_name] with actual company name and product identifier.

shall_sentence:
The device shall comply with all required features of the NVM Express Base Specification 
Revision 2.2, the NVM Express NVM Command Set Specification Revision 1.1, and the NVM 
Express NVMe over PCIe Transport Specification Revision 1.2, or later except as overridden 
by this specification.
after_shall:
Optional features in those three specifications shall be implemented 
per the requirements of this specification based on the three specifications above.

shall_sentence:
Optional features in those three specifications shall be implemented 
per the requirements of this specification based on the three specifications above.
before_shall:
The device shall comply with all required features of the NVM Express Base Specification 
Revision 2.2, the NVM Express NVM Command Set Specification Revision 1.1, and the NVM 
Express NVMe over PCIe Transport Specification Revision 1.2, or later except as overridden 
by this specification.
after_shall:
The 
vendor shall provide an NVMe compliance report that demonstrates compliance.

shall_sentence:
The 
vendor shall provide an NVMe compliance report that demonstrates compliance.
before_shall:
Optional features in those three specifications shall be implemented 
per the requirements of this specification based on the three specifications above.

shall_sentence:
NVMe-2 
Any optional NVMe features supported by the device not described in this document shall 
be clearly documented and disclosed to the customer.

NVMe-3 
Any vendor unique features supported by the device not described in this document shall 
be clearly documented and disclosed to the customer.

NVMeR-1 
NVM Subsystem Reset (NSSR) shall be supported via the NSSRC register.

NVMeR-2 
NVMe Controller Reset (CC.EN cleared from 1b to 0b) shall be supported.

NVMe-CFG-1 
The default arbitration shall be Round-Robin.
after_shall:
Weighted Round Robin with Urgent Class 
Priority shall be supported.

shall_sentence:
Weighted Round Robin with Urgent Class 
Priority shall be supported.
before_shall:
NVMe-CFG-1 
The default arbitration shall be Round-Robin.

shall_sentence:
NVMe-CFG-2 
The device shall support a Maximum Data Transfer Size (MDTS) value of at least 256 KiB.

NVMe-CFG-3 
The device firmware shall support the use of CSTS.CFS.

NVMe-CFG-5 
The minimum supported queue depth shall be 1,024 per submission queue.

NVMe-CFG-6 
The minimum number of I/O Queue Pairs shall be 1,023.

The single default namespace (see SECTOR-3) shall have a unique non-zero value in the 
EUI64 (Extended Unique Identifier) field in the Identify Namespace data structure.
after_shall:
For each namespace that is created other than the initial namespace configured in the 
factory, the device shall clear the EUI64 field to 0h in the Identify Namespace data structure.

shall_sentence:
For each namespace that is created other than the initial namespace configured in the 
factory, the device shall clear the EUI64 field to 0h in the Identify Namespace data structure.
before_shall:
The single default namespace (see SECTOR-3) shall have a unique non-zero value in the 
EUI64 (Extended Unique Identifier) field in the Identify Namespace data structure.
after_shall:
This requirement is specific to the value of the EUI64 field in the Identify Namespace data 
structure and has no effect on the value of the NGUID field in that data structure.

shall_sentence:
The device shall support a non-zero NGUID per Namespace and shall never reuse any 
NGUID value (i.e., the UIDREUSE bit in the Common Namespace Features field of the 
Identify Namespace data structure shall be set to 1b).

NVMe-CFG-9 
The Doorbell Stride field in the Controller Capabilities data structure (CAP.DSTRD) shall be 
cleared to 0h.
NVMe-CFG-10 The device shall align the start of the Doorbells to a 4096-byte boundary as per the PCI

If the Controller Memory Buffer (CMB) is supported, then the implementation shall comply 
with TP4054, which is included in the NVMe Express Base Specification 1.4 and subsequent 
versions (see NVMe-1).
after_shall:
This includes the requirement that the CMB shall be disabled by 
default.

shall_sentence:
This includes the requirement that the CMB shall be disabled by 
default.
before_shall:
If the Controller Memory Buffer (CMB) is supported, then the implementation shall comply 
with TP4054, which is included in the NVMe Express Base Specification 1.4 and subsequent 
versions (see NVMe-1).

shall_sentence:
The Controller Power Scope field in the Controller Capabilities property shall be set to a 
value of 11b to indicate it is NVM subsystem scope (i.e., the NVM subsystem does not 
support multiple power domains).

The device shall support the NVM Command Set (i.e., in the Command Sets Supported field 
in the Controller Capabilities (CAP) property bit 0 shall be set to 1b, bit 6 shall be cleared to 
0b, and bit 7 shall be cleared to 0b, and the Controller Type field in the Identify Controller 
data structure shall be set to 01h).
key_phrases: The device shall support the NVM Command

Sets Supported field 
in the Controller Capabilities

shall_sentence: NVMe-CFG-14 The device shall support a maximum Submission Queue Entry Size of 64 bytes (i.e., bits 7:4
of the SQES field in the Identify Controller data structure shall be set to 6).
NVMe-CFG-15 The device shall support a maximum Completion Queue Entry Size of 16 bytes (i.e., bits 7:4
of the CQES field in the Identify Controller data structure shall be set to 4).
NVMe-CFG-16 The device shall clear the Memory Page Size Minimum (MPSMIN) field to 0h (4 KiB
NVMe-CFG-17 The device shall set the Memory Page Size Maximum (MPSMAX) field to a value of 1h or
NVMe-CFG-18 The device shall support 256 Error Log Page Entries.

The device shall clear the Host Memory Buffer Minimum Size field and the Host Memory 
Buffer Preferred Size field in the Identify Controller data structure to 0h (i.e., the Host 
Memory Buffer feature shall not be supported).
NVMe-CFG-20 The device shall clear the CAP.CRMS.CRIMS bit to 0b.
NVMe-CFG-21 The device shall support Power Measurement (See TP4199).
NVMe-CFG-22 The device shall not write to any memory in any Submission Queue (SQ).
NVMe-CFG-23 The device shall not read from any memory in any Completion Queue (CQ).

host performance:

mandatory fields within the data returned for each mandatory CNS value, the following

shall_sentence: The device shall support the Sanitize command and the Sanitize Status Log Page (81h).
after_shall:

device shall support Block Erase (010b), Overwrite (011b), and Crypto Erase (100b) sanitize 
operations.
key_phrases: and the Sanitize Status Log Page
The device shall support the Sanitize command

shall_sentence:
The 
device shall support Block Erase (010b), Overwrite (011b), and Crypto Erase (100b) sanitize 
operations.
before_shall: The device shall support the Sanitize command and the Sanitize Status Log Page (81h).
after_shall:
The Sanitize Namespace command defined in TP4153 is optional for the device 
to support.
key_phrases: and the Sanitize Status Log Page
The device shall support the Sanitize command

shall_sentence:
• 
a Sanitize command that requests a sanitize operation and has the No-Deallocate 
After Sanitize bit cleared to 0b; 
• 
a Sanitize command that requests a Block Erase (SANACT=001b) or Crypto Erase 
(SANACT=100b) sanitize operation and has the No-Deallocate After Sanitize bit set 
to 1b but resulted in a deallocate for the reason specified in NVMe-AD-19; 
• 
a Format NVM command that specifies User Data Erase or Cryptographic Erase; or 
• 
a TCG Revert method, RevertSP method or GenKey method, 
the device shall deallocate all user data, enable reads to the purged/deallocated LBAs 
without generating errors, and return all zeroes for host reads to LBAs that have not been 
written since the last such purge completed.
key_phrases: that requests a sanitize operation and has the No
that specifies User Data Erase or Cryptographic Erase

shall_sentence:
Once data is purged (see SEC-43) due to a Sanitize command that requests an Overwrite 
(SANACT=011b) sanitize operation, and has the No-Deallocate After Sanitize bit set to 1b, 
the device shall not deallocate any user data, shall enable reads to the overwritten LBAs 
without generating errors, and shall return the bytes written by the last overwrite pass for 
host reads to LBAs that have not been written since the last such purge completed.

NVMe-AD-10 
The device shall support Identify command UUID List functionality (CNS value 17h).
key_phrases: The device shall support Identify command

shall_sentence:
If the Namespace Identifier (NSID) is not used for a specific NVMe Admin command, and the 
host specifies a non-zero NSID, then the controller shall abort the command with status 
Invalid Field in Command.

then the controller shall abort the command with status

NVMe-AD-12 
The Device Self-test command shall be supported.

NVMe-AD-14 
The device shall support the Lockdown command.

For device profile specific requirements 
see DP-CFG-11.
key_phrases: The device shall support the Lockdown command

shall_sentence:
The Lockdown command shall support locking down all supported Admin commands on the 
in-band interface including the Lockdown command itself and all Admin commands not 
referenced in this specification.

The Lockdown command shall support locking down all supported Features on the in-band 
interface, including those not referenced in this specification.

shall_sentence:
The device shall set the No-Deallocate Modifies Media After Sanitize field to 01b in the 
Sanitize Capabilities in the Identify Controller data structure.
after_shall:
Additional media modification 
after Sanitize is prohibited.

shall_sentence:
NVMe-AD-18 
The device shall clear the No-Deallocate Inhibited bit to 0b in the Sanitize Capabilities in the 
Identify Controller data structure.

If the device cannot return logical block data due to checksum errors after a sanitize 
operation successfully completes that had been started by a Sanitize command with the No-
Deallocate After Sanitize bit set to 1b, then the device shall instead perform a deallocation 
even though it was requested not to deallocate and shall set the Sanitize Status field to 100b 
in the Sanitize Status log page upon successful completion of the sanitize operation and 
deallocation.
after_shall:
This behavior overrides the requirements in the NVM Express Base 
Specification.
key_phrases:
If the device cannot return logical block data due to checksum errors after a sanitize 
operation successfully completes that had been started by a Sanitize command

shall_sentence:
The device shall not write data to any namespace user data in the NVM subsystem as part of 
a Crypto Erase sanitize operation, Block Erase sanitize operation, Format NVM Cryptographic 
Erase, Format NVM User Data Erase, or TCG Opal Revert/RevertSP/GenKey method.

The device shall be shipped from the factory with the Sanitize Status field in the Sanitize 
Status log page cleared to 000b indicating the NVM subsystem has never been sanitized and 
the Global Data Erased bit in the Sanitize Status field set to 1b.

NVMe-AD-23 
The device shall support the Format NVM command on a per namespace basis (i.e., bit 0 
and bit 1 shall be cleared to 00b in the Format NVM Attributes field in Identify Controller).
key_phrases: The device shall support the Format NVM command

shall_sentence:
The device shall report a minimum value of 3 in the Asynchronous Event Request Limit field 
in the Identify Controller data structure to indicate support for at least 4 outstanding 
Asynchronous Event Request commands.

If asynchronous events occur for which reporting is enabled and there are no Asynchronous 
Event Request commands outstanding, then the controller shall retain the event 
information for those Asynchronous Event Types and use that information for responses to 
future Asynchronous Event Request commands.
after_shall:
Queued duplicate Asynchronous events 
shall be reported once.
key_phrases:
If asynchronous events occur for which reporting is enabled and there are no Asynchronous 
Event Request command

then the controller shall retain the event 
information for those Asynchronous Event Types and use that information for responses to 
future Asynchronous Event Request command

Event Request commands outstanding, then the controller shall retain the event

future Asynchronous Event Request commands.

are never queued.

The device shall support Media Verification for entire device sanitize operations initiated by 
the Sanitize command.

shall_sentence:
The device shall clear the DAE bit to 0b in the NSFEAT field in Identify Namespace to indicate 
that the device does not support the Deallocated or Unwritten Logical Block error for any 
namespace.

The device shall support both the 0b and 1b values of the No-Deallocate After Sanitize bit in 
the Sanitize command.
after_shall:
If the No-Deallocate After Sanitize bit is cleared to 0b in a Sanitize 
command, then the device shall deallocate all LBAs upon completion of the sanitize 
operation, including media verification (see NVMe-AD-26), if performed as part of the 
sanitize operation.
key_phrases:
Deallocate After Sanitize bit in 
the Sanitize command

shall_sentence:
NVMe-AD-30 
The controller shall delete all queued Asynchronous Event Notifications upon Power Cycle or 
Controller Level Reset events.

For the DSSD Error Reporting asynchronous event, the default value for the DSSD 
Asynchronous Event Configuration feature (Feature Identifier C9h) shall be set to 1 (i.e., 
enabled).
after_shall: See GDAEC-2.

shall_sentence:
For the DSSD Media Ready asynchronous event, the default value for the DSSD 
Asynchronous Event Configuration feature (Feature Identifier C9h) shall be cleared to 0 (i.e., 
disabled).
after_shall: See GDAEC-3.

shall_sentence:
NSM-1 
The namespace management commands shall be supported on all namespaces.

When creating a namespace, the default “Formatted LBA Size” parameter (FLBAS = 0) in the 
Identify Namespace Data Structure (byte 26) shall correspond to the default sector size set 
at the factory.

NSM-3 
The LBA Format 0 Support field shall correspond to the default sector size set at the factory 
(see DP-CFG-1).

NSM-4 
The device shall support a minimum of 16 Namespaces (see Section 13 Device Profiles).

For some models (see Section 13 Device Profiles), the minimum number of namespaces 
shall be at least 128 Namespaces at 7 TiB based on 16 Namespaces per TB of usable 
capacity.
after_shall:
The number of Namespaces shall be based on the device usable capacity as 
follows:

The number of Namespaces shall be based on the device usable capacity as 
follows:

For some models (see Section 13 Device Profiles), the minimum number of namespaces 
shall be at least 128 Namespaces at 7 TiB based on 16 Namespaces per TB of usable 
capacity.

shall_sentence:
NSM-6 
The device shall report at least one Namespace Granularity Descriptor in the Namespace 
Granularity List.

NSM-7 
The device shall support the TNVMCAP and UNVMCAP fields in the Identify Controller Data 
Structure.

The device shall not support extended LBA formats (i.e., the Extended LBA Formats 
Supported bit in the Controller Attributes register in the Identify Controller data structure 
shall be cleared to ‘0’).
key_phrases:
Extended LBA Formats 
Supported bit in the Controller Attributes register

shall_sentence:
The NUSE shall be equal to the number of logical blocks currently allocated in the 
namespace.
after_shall: NUSE cannot be hardcoded to be equal to NCAP.

4.15 Set/Get Feature Requirements) shall access the vendor specific Feature defined 
in this specification.

UUID-4 
The Get Log Page command shall support UUID Index functionality.

• 
the UUID Index of the UUID (UUID-1) in the UUID List (NVMe-AD-10) or a zero UUID 
Index; and

a vendor-specific Log Page Identifier that is defined in this specification (see Section 
4.8.4 DSSD Log Page Requirements) 
shall access the specified vendor specific log page defined in this specification.

UUID-6 
The vendor-specific events in the Persistent Event log page shall support UUID Index 
functionality.

shall_sentence:
Since the device is power fail safe (e.g., has Power Loss Protection (PLP)) the performance 
shall not be degraded by any of the following:

volatile.

If the Write Zeroes DEAC bit is set to 1b and the FUA bit is cleared to 0b, the device shall 
deallocate the specified LBAs and shall return all zeros for any subsequent read to the 
specified LBAs until modified by a command (e.g., Write, Copy, etc.), regardless of the 
behavior of the Dataset Management command.

shall be able to completely deallocate the entire device including updating the FTL map 
(e.g., in memory) so that subsequent reads return all zeroes as required by NVMe-IO-6 in 
less than one minute.

NVMe-IO-15 
The device shall support SGLs for all I/O commands.

NVMe-IO-16 
The device shall support SGL Descriptor Type 0, 1, 2 and 3.

The device shall configure SGLS (SGL Support) 2-bit field in the SGLS Dword field in the 
Identify Controller Data Structure to a value of 01b (byte alignment) or 10b (Dword 
alignment).
after_shall: Host code should use Dword alignment regardless of this field value.

shall_sentence:
NVMe-IO-18 
The device shall set the MPTR SGL Descriptor Support (MSDS) bit to 1b in the Identify 
Controller Data Structure.
The device shall also support the following NVMe features:

NVMe-OPT-2 
The device shall support the Timestamp feature (Feature Identifier 0Eh).
after_shall:
Timestamps are 
used to align the devices internal logs.

shall_sentence: a) the device shall maintain the timestamp across all Controller Level Resets other

timestamp has been set, then it is only permissible to clear the Timestamp Origin 
field to 000b due to an NVM Subsystem Reset and the device shall set the 
Timestamp Origin field to 001b for all Controller Level Resets other than NVM 
Subsystem Reset); and 
b) saving the timestamp across an NVM Subsystem Reset is optional.

NVMe-OPT-5 
The device shall never set the Synch field bit to 1b in the Timestamp feature (Feature 
Identifier 0Eh).

NVMe-OPT-6 
The device shall only generate a Telemetry Log Changed event on an error condition and 
shall not generate a Telemetry Log Changed event for periodic logging.

NVMe-OPT-7 
The device shall report its Indirection Unit (IU) size in the Namespace Preferred Write 
Granularity (NPWG) field in the Identify Namespace data structure.

NVMe-OPT-8 
The device shall support sending Telemetry Log Notices (i.e., bit 3 of the Log Page Attributes 
field shall be set to 1b).

The device shall support the Namespace Attribute Changed asynchronous event and the 
associated Changed Namespace List log page (i.e., bit 8 of the Optional Asynchronous 
Events Supported field shall be set to 1b in the Identify Controller data structure).

event shall only be reported for namespaces that are attached to a controller.

shall_sentence:
The device shall support the Firmware Activation Notices event (i.e., bit 9 shall be set to 1b 
in the Optional Asynchronous Events Supported field in the Identify Controller data 
structure).

The device shall be composed of a single NVM subsystem (i.e., the CAP.CPS field shall be set 
to 11b in the CAP controller register, and the MDS bit shall be cleared to 0b in the Controller 
Attributes field in the Identify Controller data structure).
NVMe-OPT-13 The Timestamp feature (Feature Identifier 0Eh) shall not be saveable.

register writes (i.e., the device shall not generate an error because a reserved bit or field is 
not cleared to zero).

shall_sentence:
Once the TTR-2 requirement is satisfied, an individual I/O command (submitted under 
Queue Depth 1) shall take no more than 8 seconds from submission to completion.
after_shall:
Under 
full load the device shall not have more than 7 I/Os take more than 2 seconds in one hour.

Under

CTO-4 
I/O command processing time shall not be a function of device capacity.
key_phrases: processing time shall not be a function of device capacity

shall_sentence:
CTO-5 
The vendor shall disclose any I/O scenario that could violate the timeout requirements in 
CTO-1 through CTO-4.

The device shall set MDTS, the attributes of the Number of Queues feature (Feature 
Identifier 07h) and Maximum Queue Entries Supported such that the CTO-3 requirement 
cannot be violated.

CTO-7 
A Crypto Erase sanitize operation, and any background activity initiated by a TCG command 
(e.g., as indicated by OutstandingData) shall complete within 10 seconds.
key_phrases: and any background activity initiated by a TCG command

shall_sentence:
A Block Erase sanitize operation and a Format NVM command performing a User Data Erase 
shall each complete within 10 seconds per TB of device capacity (e.g., a Block Erase sanitize 
operation on a 4TB device shall complete within 40 seconds).
key_phrases: A Block Erase sanitize operation and a Format NVM command

performing a User Data Erase 
shall each complete within

shall_sentence:
The device shall report the greater of the Sanitize Crypto Erase, Format NVM Cryptographic 
Erase, TCG Opal Revert, TCG Opal RevertSP, or TCG Opal GenKey time in the Estimated Time 
for Crypto Erase field in the Sanitize Status log page.

CTO-10 
The device shall not set the Estimated Time fields in the Sanitize Status log page to a value 
of FFFFFFFFh for supported sanitize operations.

Formats between LBAF values with the Secure Erase Settings field cleared to 000b (No 
secure erase operation requested) or 2h (Cryptographic Erase) shall complete within 10 
seconds.

STD-LOG-1 
The device shall support the Error Information log page (Log Identifier 01h).

The device shall support the SMART / Health Information log page (Log Identifier 02h).

STD-LOG-3 
Under no conditions shall the Percentage Used field in the SMART / Health Information log 
page (Log Identifier 02h) decrease to a lower value than previously reported.

The Percentage Used field in the SMART / Health Information log page (Log Identifier 02h) 
shall be based on the average P/E cycle of the device.

on the actual P/E cycle count of the media and not on the Power on Hours (POH) of the 
device.

STD-LOG-15 
The device shall support the Physical Interface Receiver Eye Opening Measurement log page 
(Log Identifier 19h).

In addition to any receiver margining data and image plots, the device shall store 
information required to evaluate the signal integrity of the receiver such as equalization 
values like continuous time linear equalization (CTLE), variable gain amplifier (VGA), boost, 
and decision feedback equalization (DFE) settings in the Eye Data field of the Physical 
Interface Receiver Eye Opening Measurement log page.

after_shall: The device shall use a single Endurance Group for the entire device.

shall_sentence: The device shall use a single Endurance Group for the entire device.

The device is not 
required to support the Endurance Group Event Aggregate log page (Log Identifier 0Fh).

shall_sentence:
The device shall not support the SMART / Health Information log page (Log Identifier 02h) 
on a per namespace basis (i.e., bit 0 of the Log Page Attributes field in the Identify Controller 
data structure shall be cleared to 0b).

The Persistent Event log page (Log Identifier 0Dh), Telemetry Host-Initiated log page (Log 
Identifier 07h), Telemetry Controller-Initiated log page (Log Identifier 08h), and Error 
Information log page (Log Identifier 01h) shall not contain user data, or the result of any 
computation performed on user data.

The Persistent Event log page (Log Identifier 0Dh) events shall be ordered so that the more 
recent events are reported earlier in the log than older events (i.e., the most recent event is 
Persistent Event 0), and the events deemed less important by the vendor (e.g., old events, 
informational events, etc.) are removed first when the log is trimmed due to lack of space to 
store all events).

The Persistent Event log page (Log Identifier 0Dh) reporting context shall be held until 
released by the host or until at least 5 minutes has elapsed since the last host access of the 
log unless the log fills and reporting context has to be released in order to remove events 
(see STD-LOG-20).
after_shall:
New events that occur while the context is established shall not be 
dropped.

shall_sentence:
New events that occur while the context is established shall not be 
dropped.
before_shall:

(see STD-LOG-20).

shall_sentence:
The maximum size of the Persistent Event log page (Log Identifier 0Dh) reported in the 
Persistent Event Log Size (PELS) field in the Identify Controller data structure shall be 5 MiB 
or greater.

The device shall not lose log page data for any reason, unless otherwise specified (e.g., see 
STD-LOG-20 and the purge exception in this requirement).

including the Telemetry Host-Initiated log page (Log Identifier 07h), Telemetry Controller-
Initiated log page (Log Identifier 08h), Persistent Event log page (Log Identifier 0Dh), Error 
Information log page (Log Identifier 01h), vendor-specific log pages, SMART / Health 
Information log page (Log Identifier 02h) including the Critical Warnings field, SMART / 
Health Information Extended log page (Log Identifier C0h), and backup energy source failure 
information shall be persisted across purge operations (see SEC-43).

SLOG-1 
All values in the DSSD log pages defined by this specification shall be persistent across 
power cycles unless otherwise specified.

All counters defined by this specification shall be saturating counters (i.e., if the counter 
reaches the maximum allowable size, it stops incrementing and does NOT roll back to 0) 
unless otherwise specified.

SLOG-3 
All fields in DSSD log pages shall be little endian format.

reported as the following: 100% shall represent the number at factory exit.

SLOG-5 
The device shall support all fields in the SMART / Health Information log page.

A Get Log Page command for either the SMART /Health Information log page (Log Identifier 
02h) or SMART / Health Information Extended log page (Log Identifier C0h) shall not require 
an update of the SMART values other than the temperature values in SLOG-8.

simple read of the current data and shall not block I/O.

simple read of the current data and shall not block I/O.

shall_sentence:
Unless otherwise specified, the device shall update the values of the SMART /Health 
Information log page (Log Identifier 02h) and SMART / Health Information Extended log 
page (Log Identifier C0h) in the background at least once every ten minutes.

SLOG-8 
The composite and raw temperature sensor values shall be updated when the SMART / 
Health Information log page (Log Identifier 02h) is accessed.

SLOG-9 
All assert events and controller-initiated log captures shall have an associated vendor-
specific “Reason Identifier” that uniquely identifies the assert /controller condition.

The device shall not set any bits in the Critical Warning field in the SMART / Health 
Information log page (Log Identifier 02h) solely due to the value in the Percentage Used field 
in the SMART/ Health Information log page (Log Identifier 02h).

SLOG-13

field in the SMART/ Health Information log page (Log Identifier 02h).

shall_sentence:
The DSSD Firmware Revision field shall have the 
following format: 
<Major Revision>.<Minor Revision>.<Release Revision> 
where:

• 
each sub-revision field (i.e., <Major Revision>, 
<Minor Revision>, and <Release Revision>) shall 
be a base-ten integer in the range 0 to 99, 
represented in ASCII; 
• 
the most significant sub-revision field (i.e., 
<Major Revision>) shall be on left; 
• 
each sub-revision field shall be separated by a 
period (ASCII 2Eh); 
• 
each sub-revision field of lesser significance shall 
reset to “0” (ASCII 30h) when a more significant 
sub-revision field increments (e.g., the next 
<Major Revision> release after 1.2.3 would be 
2.0.0 and the next <Minor Revision> release 
after 1.2.3 would be 1.3.0); 
• 
the Firmware Revision field shall not contain 
padding of any kind at the start or in the middle 
of the string (e.g., zeroes or spaces); and 
• 
if the Firmware Revision field is less than 8 
characters, then the Firmware Revision field 
shall be padded with spaces at the end of the 
string per the NVM Express Base Specification.

LMLOG-1 
All values in the Latency Monitor log page shall be persistent across power cycles and resets 
unless otherwise specified.

LMLOG-2 
All counters shall be saturating counters (i.e., if the counter reaches the maximum allowable 
size, it stops incrementing and does NOT roll back to 0).

LMLOG-3 
All values in the Latency Monitor log page shall be little endian format.

LMLOG-4 
A read of the Latency Monitor log page shall be a simple read of the active data and shall 
not block IO.

LMLOG-5 
Data in the Latency Monitor log page which is read by the host shall be no more than 10 
minutes old.

LMLOG-6 
When configuring the Latency Monitoring Feature with Set Features the Active Buckets and 
Static Buckets shall be reset.

LMLOG-7 
When powering on, the counters shall run based on the previously configured values.

TELSLG-1 
All Statistic Identifiers contained in Data Area 1 and Data Area 2 shall be contained in this log 
page.

TELSLG-2 
String Identifier Table entries shall be in numeric order such that the smallest Vendor 
Unique Statistic Identifier is at the lowest address.

TELSLG-3 
All Debug Event Class/ Event Identifier combinations contained in Telemetry Data Area 1 and 
Telemetry Data Area 2 shall be contained in this log page.

TELSLG-4 
All Debug Event Class/ VU Event Identifier combinations contained in Telemetry Data Area 1 
and Telemetry Data Area 2 shall be contained in this log page.

TELSLG-5 
String Event Table entries shall be in numeric order such that the smallest Debug event Class 
is at the lowest address.

TELSLG-6 
String VU Event Table entries shall be in numeric order such that the smallest Debug event 
Class is at the lowest address.

TELSLG-7 
String Event Table entries shall be in numeric order such that for a single Debug/Event 
Identifier combination the smallest Event Identifier is at the lowest address.

TELSLG-8 
String VU Event Table entries shall be in numeric order such that for a single Debug/VU 
Event Identifier combination the smallest VU Event Identifier is at the lowest address.

TELSLG-9 
In the ASCII table (See Section 4.8.15.2 Telemetry String Log Page Format), characters which 
are not valid (beyond the length of the ASCII length) shall be set to <space> (i.e., 20h).

TELSLG-10 
The String Identifier Table shall have no gaps between this table and the String Event Table.

TELSLG-11 
The String Event Table entry shall have no gaps between this table and the VU String Event 
Table.

TELSLG-12 
The VU String Event Table and the ASCII table shall have no gaps between these tables.

shall_sentence:
The data format in the Telemetry Host-Initiated 
log page and the Telemetry Controller-Initiated log page shall be the same format (see Section 4.6.16.1 
Telemetry Data Format).
before_shall:
The 
data generated by the device for monitoring and/or debugging which impacts I/O (performance/latency) for 
active commands in progress goes into Telemetry Data Area 2.
after_shall:
The information (i.e., statistics and events) reported in Telemetry Host-Initiated Data Areas 1 and 2 shall be the 
same as Telemetry Controller-Initiated Data Areas 1 and 2.

shall_sentence:
The information (i.e., statistics and events) reported in Telemetry Host-Initiated Data Areas 1 and 2 shall be the 
same as Telemetry Controller-Initiated Data Areas 1 and 2.
before_shall:
The data format in the Telemetry Host-Initiated 
log page and the Telemetry Controller-Initiated log page shall be the same format (see Section 4.6.16.1 
Telemetry Data Format).
after_shall:
There is no requirement that the data contents of 
Telemetry Host-Initiated Data Areas 1 and 2 be the same as the data contents of Telemetry Controller-Initiated 
Data Areas 1 and 2 because each log page is captured by different events, and each log page reports current data 
(e.g., counts of commands processed) at the time of capture.

shall_sentence:
TEL-1 
The device shall track the operational/event history and any critical parameters that can be 
used to debug issues.

TEL-2 
The vendor shall provide a table that categorizes the reason identifiers that are a super set 
of the Error IDs in EREC-4.

The Reason Identifier field (in the Telemetry Controller-Initiated log page and the Telemetry 
Host-Initiated log page) shall be the most recent failure identifier and shall not be cleared by 
a power cycle, reset, or any other mechanism.
required for root-cause analysis shall be included in Telemetry Data Area 3.
after_shall:
If the vendor-
specific data required for root-cause analysis does not fit within Telemetry Data Area 3, then 
the additional vendor-specific data shall be included in Telemetry Data Area 4.

shall_sentence:
If the vendor-
specific data required for root-cause analysis does not fit within Telemetry Data Area 3, then 
the additional vendor-specific data shall be included in Telemetry Data Area 4.
before_shall: required for root-cause analysis shall be included in Telemetry Data Area 3.
after_shall:
See TEL-26 
for additional requirements that apply to use of Telemetry Data Area 4.

shall_sentence:
TEL-6 
The device shall set the Telemetry Host-Initiated Data Area 1 Last Block field of the 
Telemetry Host-Initiated log page (Log Identifier 07h) to 0040h as the factory default.

TEL-7 
The device shall set the Telemetry Controller-Initiated Data Area 1 Last Block field of the 
Telemetry Controller-Initiated log page (Log Identifier 08h) to 0040h as the factory default.

TEL-8 
Information that is used to populate Telemetry Data Area 1 shall be updated in the 
background at least once every ten minutes.

TEL-10 
The number of Timestamp Events inserted into the Event FIFOs shall be sufficient to debug.

For any issue that causes the controller to generate the Telemetry Controller-Initiated log 
page, the complete contents of each of the Telemetry Controller-Initiated log page and 
Telemetry Host-Initiated log page shall contain all of the debug information needed to root 
cause the issue.

TEL-12 
Updating the Error ID in the TELRI-1 Reason Identifier field shall cause a Telemetry Log 
Changed event.

TEL-13 
When the device encounters a failure/error the Error ID in TELRI-1 shall be a non-zero value.

Data in Telemetry Data Area 1 and Telemetry Data Area 2 as defined in this specification 
shall be decodable by the OCP plugin for the nvme-cli tool (version 2.10 or later) and shall 
meet the requirements for SEC-22.

TEL-15 
Telemetry Data Area 1 and Telemetry Data Area 2 shall be supported per this specification.

TEL-16 
A minimum of two Telemetry Profiles shall be supported.

TEL-17 
Telemetry Profile 0 shall be the default profile from the factory.

TEL-18 
Telemetry Profile 1 shall be sized for maximum debuggability.

TEL-19 
The device shall support TP4109a to enable the host to access specific host telemetry.

On a firmware update the Vendor Specific Statistics Identifier, the Debug Event Class/Events 
Identifier combinations and the Debug Class/VU Event Identifier combinations shall not be 
re-purposed or removed from the Telemetry String log page.
after_shall:
This is to ensure on a firmware 
update that any existing Telemetry String log page is able to be decoded correctly.

shall_sentence:
Telemetry Controller-Initiated log pages shall only be generated (Telemetry Controller-
Initiated Data Available transitions from 00h to 01h) for error conditions (e.g., they shall not 
be generated periodically, or in response to Percentage Used changes, etc.).

TEL-22 
The Telemetry Controller-Initiated log page and Telemetry Host-Initiated log page shall be 
NVM subsystem in scope.

Statistics that are listed in the Description column in the table in Section 4.9.11 Statistic 
Identifiers as coming from the SMART / Health Extended log page (Log Identifier C0h), 
SMART / Health Information log page (Log Identifier 02h), or Endurance Group Information 
log page (Log Identifier 09h) shall be implemented and shall be in Data Area 1.

For the Statistics in TEL-23, the device shall populate the Telemetry String Log with strings 
that exactly match the text in the Statistic Specific Data Field column in the table in Section 
4.9.11 Statistic Identifiers.

For the statistics in TEL-23, in the Statistic Information Field, the Host Hint Type shall be set 
to a value of Host Hint Type 1.
after_shall:
For all other statistics descriptors, the Host Hint Type shall be 
set to a value of No Host Hint.

For all other statistics descriptors, the Host Hint Type shall be 
set to a value of No Host Hint.

to a value of Host Hint Type 1.

Support feature before requesting data from Telemetry Data Area 4.

shall_sentence:
EVF-1 
The oldest event descriptor shall be at the Event FIFO Start Address.

EVF-2 
There shall be no gaps between the data in one descriptor and the next descriptor.

EVF-3 
The event FIFO shall only have complete descriptors (i.e., no partial descriptors).

EVF-4 
All data contained in the event FIFO that is not contained in an event descriptor shall be 
cleared to zero.

EVF-5 
For a single FIFO, the Event FIFO Start and Event FIFO End shall be in the same Telemetry 
Data Area.

EVF-6 
Event FIFO Start and End locations shall not overlap with the Statistic Descriptor locations.

EVF-7 
The decode of the Event Class and Vendor Unique Event Class shall be provided to the 
customer via the Telemetry String log page.

shall_sentence:
SELFTST-2 
A short device self-test operation (i.e., the STC field is set to 1h) shall complete in less than 
or equal to 2 minutes.

An extended device self-test operation (i.e., the STC field is set to 2h) shall complete in less 
than or equal to 30 minutes (i.e., the EDSTT field shall indicate a value of less than or equal 
to 30 minutes).

SELFTST-4 
A vendor-specific self-test operation (i.e., the STC field is set to Eh) shall complete the test 
specified by SELFTST-7 in less than or equal to 2 seconds.

A device self-test operation shall not fail if it is unable to complete within the specified 
completion time (e.g., due to  
concurrent host I/O activity).
after_shall:
The device shall complete 
 as many device self-test segments as possible within the allotted completion time.

shall_sentence:
The device shall complete 
 as many device self-test segments as possible within the allotted completion time.
before_shall:
A device self-test operation shall not fail if it is unable to complete within the specified 
completion time (e.g., due to  
concurrent host I/O activity).

shall_sentence:
SELFTST-6 
For a Self-test Code (STC) of 2h, the device self-test operation shall terminate upon reading 
all allocated LBAs and completing all non-media related tests.

For a Device Self-test Code (STC) of 1h or Eh, the device self-test operation shall include at a 
minimum, 
 segments 1 to 3 and 8, and as much as possible of segments 4 to 7, within the completion  
time specified for that specific operation.

The device vendor shall provide the minimum number of LBAs required to be written  
by the host to enable the extended device self-test operation to read from all physical non-
volatile memory elements (e.g., NAND die).
after_shall:
A segment shall not fail solely due to the host 
writing less than the minimum number of LBAs.

shall_sentence:
A segment shall not fail solely due to the host 
writing less than the minimum number of LBAs.
before_shall:
The device vendor shall provide the minimum number of LBAs required to be written  
by the host to enable the extended device self-test operation to read from all physical non-
volatile memory elements (e.g., NAND die).

shall_sentence:
The device self-test operation shall not be destructive to any user data (note that reading 
user data once during the device self-test operation is not considered destructive, because 
even though it technically causes read disturb,  
the effect is minimal).

FWUP-2 
Other than media end-of-life, devices shall not have any restrictions on the number of 
firmware downloads supported.

The Firmware Commit command with the following Commit Action (CA) codes shall be 
supported:

FWUP-4 
Firmware Image Download command shall be supported and shall not cause any 
performance impact.
key_phrases:
shall be supported and shall not cause any 
performance impact

shall_sentence:
FWUP-6 
The device shall support a minimum of 2 read/write slots for firmware update and may 
support up to 7.

The controller shall set the Maximum Time for Firmware Activation (MTFA) field to a value 
that is less than or equal to Ah (1s).
after_shall:
This time limit applies only to Commit Action 011b 
(firmware activation without reset) of the Firmware Commit command, see FWUP-30.

shall_sentence:
If a Firmware Commit command is processed that specifies a firmware image that has a 
Security Firmware Revision (see SMART-22) that is less than the Security Firmware Revision 
of the currently running firmware image, then the device shall abort that Firmware Commit 
command with a status code of Firmware Activation Prohibited (13h).
after_shall: See SEC-3 for additional firmware anti-rollback requirements.
key_phrases:
then the device shall abort that Firmware Commit 
command

Security Firmware Revision

shall_sentence:
The firmware image in each valid firmware slot shall have multiple copies of that firmware 
image on separate physical non-volatile memory devices (e.g., NAND die, NAND RAID stripe) 
for reliability.

FWUP-10 
Firmware activation shall not cause or require data (e.g., user data, log page contents, etc.) 
to be lost or destroyed.

FWUP-11 
Firmware activation without reset shall occur seamlessly on a running system:

• 
The device shall preserve the current state of the device (e.g., Opal locking state, 
current value of each Feature, Timestamp, I/O Submission/Completion Queue 
setup, NVMe-MI state such as MCTP Transmission Unit Size, SMBus/I2C/I3C 
Frequency, and MCTP state such as the MCTP endpoint ID, LBA format, PCIe state, 
etc.).
after_shall:
• 
The PCIe link state shall not be impacted.

shall_sentence:
• 
The PCIe link state shall not be impacted.
before_shall:
• 
The device shall preserve the current state of the device (e.g., Opal locking state, 
current value of each Feature, Timestamp, I/O Submission/Completion Queue 
setup, NVMe-MI state such as MCTP Transmission Unit Size, SMBus/I2C/I3C 
Frequency, and MCTP state such as the MCTP endpoint ID, LBA format, PCIe state, 
etc.).

shall_sentence:
FWUP-12 
The firmware image shall contain the firmware for all the device’s controllers (NVMe 
controllers, management controllers, etc.).

The VPD/FRU Data shall be a part of the device’s firmware update image and shall be field 
upgradable using the standard NVMe Firmware Image Download/Firmware Commit 
commands.
after_shall:
VPD fields that are unique to the device (e.g., Serial Number) shall be 
preserved during a firmware update.

shall_sentence:
VPD fields that are unique to the device (e.g., Serial Number) shall be 
preserved during a firmware update.
before_shall:
The VPD/FRU Data shall be a part of the device’s firmware update image and shall be field 
upgradable using the standard NVMe Firmware Image Download/Firmware Commit 
commands.

shall_sentence:
FWUP-14 
The size of the firmware shall be 6 MiB or less in order to facilitate firmware update via low-
bandwidth interfaces (e.g., NVMe-MI over SMBus).
Requiring a reset of any type to activate firmware under any condition shall be avoided.
after_shall:
If a 
reset is unavoidable, the device vendor shall request a waiver from the end customer.

shall_sentence:
If a 
reset is unavoidable, the device vendor shall request a waiver from the end customer.
before_shall: Requiring a reset of any type to activate firmware under any condition shall be avoided.
after_shall:
In 
cases where waivers are granted, a Controller Level Reset is preferred over a Conventional 
Reset.

shall_sentence:
All firmware updates shall be allowed to be performed by the system vendor or end user 
without any outside assistance from NVMe device vendor employees or anyone else and 
shall not require any additional vendor-specific actions or equipment (such as dongles, 
debug cables, etc.) unless otherwise noted in this specification.
after_shall:
This includes both pre-
production and production firmware.

shall_sentence:
Firmware updates shall not require an intermediate firmware update or "bridge code" to 
update from one firmware version to the next subsequent version (e.g., N-1 firmware 
revision to bridge firmware to N firmware is prohibited).
after_shall:
This includes both pre-production 
and production firmware.

shall_sentence:
The device shall not be left in an unusable state due to any reset or loss of power during a 
firmware update.
after_shall:
Depending on where in the device’s firmware activation process the reset 
or loss of power occurs, the device shall either:

shall_sentence:
Depending on where in the device’s firmware activation process the reset 
or loss of power occurs, the device shall either:
before_shall:
The device shall not be left in an unusable state due to any reset or loss of power during a 
firmware update.

shall_sentence:
For production-level firmware, all means of updating the firmware besides the Firmware 
Image Download/Firmware Commit commands (e.g., via MMIO or any vendor-proprietary 
mechanisms) shall be disabled.
The device shall support a read-only firmware slot (slot 1).
after_shall:
If a firmware image is 
successfully activated to a read-write slot that increases the Security Version Number (see 
SMART-22), then the device shall also update the read-only slot 1 with that firmware image.

shall_sentence:
If a firmware image is 
successfully activated to a read-write slot that increases the Security Version Number (see 
SMART-22), then the device shall also update the read-only slot 1 with that firmware image.
before_shall: The device shall support a read-only firmware slot (slot 1).

shall_sentence:
If the Firmware Slot field in the Firmware Commit command is cleared to 0h, then the 
device shall commit the firmware image to a firmware slot that does not contain the 
currently running firmware image.
key_phrases: If the Firmware Slot field in the Firmware Commit command

shall_sentence:
If the current active firmware image is corrupt, then the device shall automatically fail over 
to another backup copy of that firmware image until all backup copies of that firmware 
image are exhausted.
after_shall:
The device shall not automatically fail over to another revision of 
firmware in a different firmware slot; this overrides the NVM Express Base Specification.

shall_sentence:
The device shall not automatically fail over to another revision of 
firmware in a different firmware slot; this overrides the NVM Express Base Specification.
before_shall:
If the current active firmware image is corrupt, then the device shall automatically fail over 
to another backup copy of that firmware image until all backup copies of that firmware 
image are exhausted.
after_shall: The vendor should follow the guidelines in NIST SP 800-193.

shall_sentence: A single firmware image shall cover all the devices in a product family.
after_shall:
For example, devices 
with the same model but different capacity points, endurance or form factor shall have one 
firmware image that works on all devices.

shall_sentence:
For example, devices 
with the same model but different capacity points, endurance or form factor shall have one 
firmware image that works on all devices.
before_shall: A single firmware image shall cover all the devices in a product family.
after_shall:
A single firmware image shall cover all TCG Opal 
capable and non-TCG Opal capable devices in a given product family.

shall_sentence:
A single firmware image shall cover all TCG Opal 
capable and non-TCG Opal capable devices in a given product family.
before_shall:
For example, devices 
with the same model but different capacity points, endurance or form factor shall have one 
firmware image that works on all devices.
after_shall:
An exception is that the firmware for a family of FIPS 140-3 compliant devices is different 
than the firmware for the same family of non-FIPS 140-3 compliant devices.

shall_sentence:
In particular, 
the firmware for the family of FIPS 140-3 compliant devices shall contain the FIPS 140 
compliance descriptor (see SEC-52) whereas the firmware for the family of non-FIPS 140-3 
compliant devices shall not contain the FIPS 140 compliance descriptor.
before_shall:
An exception is that the firmware for a family of FIPS 140-3 compliant devices is different 
than the firmware for the same family of non-FIPS 140-3 compliant devices.
after_shall:
Other than the FIPS 
140 compliance descriptor, the firmware for the family of FIPS 140-3 compliant devices 
should be the same as the firmware for the same family of non-FIPS 140-3 compliant 
devices.

Every firmware image shall have a firmware signature that meets the requirements of SBT-1 
and SBT-4.
after_shall:
The device shall check the firmware signature as part of processing any 
Firmware Commit command that commits a firmware image to a firmware slot.

shall_sentence:
• 
the device shall keep a copy of the currently running firmware image until the newly 
activated firmware image completes initialization successfully at least once; and 
• 
if the firmware image that is being activated is unable to complete initialization 
successfully for any reason, then the device shall revert to the firmware that 
processed the Firmware Commit command; and 
• 
once the newly activated firmware image successfully completes initialization at 
least once, the firmware image for the firmware that processed the Firmware 
Commit command is permitted to be discarded.
key_phrases:
the firmware image for the firmware that processed the Firmware 
Commit command

then the device shall revert to the firmware that 
processed the Firmware Commit command

shall_sentence:
For a successful Firmware Commit command with Commit Action 001b or 010b (firmware is 
activated at the next Controller Level Reset) and for a Firmware Commit command with 
Commit Action 011b (activate firmware without reset) that is aborted with Firmware 
Activation Requires Controller Level Reset status, the device shall complete the firmware 
activation process within 5 seconds from the start of the Controller Level Reset.
key_phrases: and for a Firmware Commit command
For a successful Firmware Commit command

shall_sentence:
For an active slot firmware update, upon completing the firmware activate of the new 
firmware, the firmware slot shall only contain multiple copies of the active firmware with no 
other additional information.
after_shall:
When updating a firmware slot which is not active, upon 
completing the Firmware Commit command, the firmware slot being updated shall only 
contain multiple copies of the committed firmware with no other additional information.
key_phrases:
upon 
completing the Firmware Commit command

shall_sentence:
When updating a firmware slot which is not active, upon 
completing the Firmware Commit command, the firmware slot being updated shall only 
contain multiple copies of the committed firmware with no other additional information.
before_shall:
For an active slot firmware update, upon completing the firmware activate of the new 
firmware, the firmware slot shall only contain multiple copies of the active firmware with no 
other additional information.
key_phrases:
upon 
completing the Firmware Commit command

shall_sentence:
• 
if the Cryptographic Module Boundary encompasses the entire physical device, then 
the Firmware Version value(s) in the FIPS 140-3 certification shall match the value(s) 
indicated by the Firmware Revision field in the Identify Controller data structure; 
and 
• 
if the Cryptographic Module Boundary does not encompass the entire physical 
device, then there is no requirement that the Firmware Version value(s) in the FIPS 
140-3 certification match the value(s) indicated by the Firmware Revision field in the 
Identify Controller data structure.
after_shall:
SEC-47 strongly recommends that the 
Cryptographic Module Boundary not encompass the entire physical device.

shall_sentence:
FWUP-29 
The device shall set the Firmware Update Granularity (FWUG) field to 01h indicating and 
firmware update granularity of 4,096 bytes.

For a Firmware Commit command with Commit Action 011b (firmware activation without 
reset), the device shall complete the firmware activation process within MTFA seconds after 
submission of the Firmware Commit command to an empty Admin Queue, see FWUP-7.
key_phrases:
the device shall complete the firmware activation process within MTFA seconds after 
submission of the Firmware Commit command

shall_sentence:
FWUP-31 
The device shall be ready to accept host I/O and NVMe Admin commands upon completion 
of the Firmware Commit Command.
key_phrases:
O and NVMe Admin commands upon completion 
of the Firmware Commit Command

shall_sentence:
The device shall reject any attempt to commit or activate any firmware image that is not 
appropriate for the device (e.g., a firmware image for a FIPS 140-3 compliant device may or 
may not be appropriate for a device that is not FIPS 140-3 compliant, see FWUP-23).
after_shall:
Rejection of a firmware image shall neither render the device inoperable nor impair device 
functionality.

shall_sentence:
Rejection of a firmware image shall neither render the device inoperable nor impair device 
functionality.
before_shall:
The device shall reject any attempt to commit or activate any firmware image that is not 
appropriate for the device (e.g., a firmware image for a FIPS 140-3 compliant device may or 
may not be appropriate for a device that is not FIPS 140-3 compliant, see FWUP-23).
after_shall:
The means of firmware image rejection is device-specific, e.g., if different keys are used to 
sign firmware images for different devices, then attempting to commit or activate an 
inappropriate firmware image fails because the device is unable to validate the firmware 
image signature.

shall_sentence:
FDEF-1 
All firmware slots shall contain the most recent production firmware revision.

FDEF-2 
All logical blocks shall be deallocated.

The following SMART / Health Information log page (Log Identifier 02h) fields shall be 
cleared to 0h: Critical Warning, Endurance Group Critical Warning Summary, Data Units 
Read, Data Units Written, Host Read Commands, Host Write Commands, Controller Busy 
Time, Power Cycles, Power On Hours, Unsafe Shutdowns, Media, and Data Integrity Errors, 
Percentage Used, and Number of Error Information Log Entries.

FDEF-4 
The Available Spare field in the SMART / Health Information log page (Log Identifier 02h) 
shall be set to a value of 100.

FDEF-5 
The Total Number of Events field in the Persistent Event log page (Log Identifier 0Dh) shall 
be cleared to 0h.

FDEF-6 
All features that are saveable shall not have a saved value unless otherwise specified.
after_shall:
This 
requirement applies to features in the NVM Express Specifications and this specification.

shall_sentence:
TRIM-1 
The device shall support the Deallocate attribute of the Dataset Management command.
key_phrases: The device shall support the Deallocate attribute of the Dataset Management command

shall_sentence:
Once the device has deallocated a logical block, a read of that logical block shall return all 
bytes cleared to 0h until that logical block has been modified by a command (e.g., Write, 
Copy, etc.) (i.e., bits 2:0 = 001b in the Deallocate Logical Block Features (DLFEAT) field in the 
Identify Namespace data structure).
key_phrases: h until that logical block has been modified by a command

shall_sentence:
TRIM-4 
Device deallocated logical blocks shall provide the performance and reliability benefits of 
overprovisioned space.

TRIM-5 
The device shall support Garbage Collection during periods of no I/O (Idle GC).

Processing of deallocation requested by a Dataset Management command shall not cause 
read latency for LBAs that are outside the LBA ranges being deallocated to change by more 
than 5% from baseline.
key_phrases:
shall not cause 
read latency for LBAs that are outside the LBA ranges being deallocated to change by more 
than
Processing of deallocation requested by a Dataset Management command

shall_sentence:
TRIM-7 
If Read I/O occurs while Idle GC is active, then Read latency shall not increase more than 5% 
from baseline.

If any device deallocated logical blocks have been subsequently read or written to, then the 
contents of those logical blocks shall not change as a consequence of an unsafe power down 
event.

The device shall deallocate data to the maximum extent possible provided that it does not 
violate TRIM-6 or TRIM-7.
after_shall:
Background deallocate processing is allowed provided that it 
does not violate TRIM-8.

shall_sentence:
A new device shipped from the factory shall have one active Namespace whose size in bytes 
and capacity in bytes are the same and consume the maximum capacity that is listed on the 
device label (see SECTOR-5).

SECTOR-4 
The device shall support 512-byte and 4096-byte logical block sizes.

The capacity listed on the device label (see the capacity row in LABL-1) and the maximum 
number of logical blocks that the device is able to allocate to a single namespace (i.e., the 
maximum possible value of NCAP) shall comply with the latest revision of the SFF-8447 
Specification for LBA Count for Disk Drives:

A device that has 128TB raw NAND capacity shall list a capacity of 122.88 TB or greater on 
the device label.
after_shall:
A device that has 256TB raw NAND capacity shall list a capacity of 245.76 
TB or greater on the device label.

shall_sentence:
A device that has 256TB raw NAND capacity shall list a capacity of 245.76 
TB or greater on the device label.
before_shall:
A device that has 128TB raw NAND capacity shall list a capacity of 122.88 TB or greater on 
the device label.
after_shall:
Some devices are required to list exactly 122.88 TB capacity or exactly 245.76 TB capacity on 
the device label, i.e., listing a greater capacity is prohibited, see DP-CFG-12.

shall_sentence:
Unless otherwise specified, the device shall support 
all the features defined in this section.
before_shall: This section describes features defined by this specification.

shall_sentence:
GETF-1 
For any Feature Identifier defined in this section, Selection (SEL) values 00b to 11b in Dword 
10 of the Get Features command shall be supported.

GETF-2 
If the feature requested by Set Features or by Get Features is not supported, then a status 
error code of 02h (Invalid Field in Command) shall be returned.

GETF-3 
The device shall not implement a Feature with Feature Identifier D0h.

The device shall return the appropriate status based on 
the NVM Express Specifications.

In addition, the host may set that field to a valid NSID if 
the feature is Namespace scoped.

to

Feature Identifier defined in this section, then the following capabilities for that Feature

shall_sentence:
If the scope of the Feature (see Section 4.15.2 DSSD Feature Requirements) is Namespace, 
then the NSSPEC bit shall be set to 1b, otherwise, the NSSPEC bit shall be cleared to 0b.
after_shall:
If the Feature is saveable (see Section 4.15.2 DSSD Feature Requirements), then the SVBL bit 
shall be set to 1b, otherwise the SVBL bit shall be cleared to 0b.

If the Feature is saveable (see Section 4.15.2 DSSD Feature Requirements), then the SVBL bit 
shall be set to 1b, otherwise the SVBL bit shall be cleared to 0b.

then the NSSPEC bit shall be set to 1b, otherwise, the NSSPEC bit shall be cleared to 0b.

shall_sentence:
Once the trigger conditions specified in an Event Injection Entry are met, the device shall 
inject the defined error event such that the host can detect the error through device 
behavior, e.g., an AEN being sent, the CFS bit being set, delayed receipt of command 
completion, or command being aborted.
after_shall:
The device is not required to cause the injected 
error to occur (e.g., injecting an Incomplete Shutdown error requires the device to behave 
as if an Incomplete Shutdown occurred, but does not require the device to perform an 
Incomplete Shutdown).

shall_sentence:
The device shall clear the triggered event, if any, at the next power cycle (i.e., next power 
cycle reverts device behavior to have no injected event) unless otherwise specified for a 
specific injected event in Section 4.15.3.3 Event Definition Table (e.g., see the definition of 
Recovery Type 4 in EVTREC-4).

shall_sentence:
The device shall respond to this event injection by 
simulating an incomplete shutdown condition on 
the next power cycle where the device shall behave 
as if the device was not able to flush all its 
metadata to stable storage.

The device shall respond to this event injection by 
simulating an unrepairable corruption of a 
metadata structure (e.g., FTL).

The device shall respond to this event injection by 
behaving as if the amount of erased usable NAND 
has dropped below a threshold that causes the 
device to prioritize garbage collection and NAND 
erasure to avoid having to reject writes because no 
NAND is available to be written.

The device shall respond to this event injection by 
inserting a delay in the first IO after the number of 
reads specified in NRTDE.

shall_sentence:
The device shall respond to this event injection by 
setting the Temperature Threshold Condition (TTC) 
bit (I.e., bit 1) to 1b in the Critical Warning field in 
the SMART / Health Information log page (Log 
Identifier 02h), completing an appropriately 
populated AER to send a Temperature Threshold 
AEN (event 01h for Asynchronous Event Type 01h) 
to the host and engaging first level thermal 
throttling.

device is reset by any Controller Level Reset

shall_sentence:
If the device is thermally throttling due to an active 
Thermal Throttle Engaged (see EVTDEF-20) Event 
Injection, the device shall respond to this event 
injection by sending the Temperature Threshold 
AEN (event 01h for Asynchronous Event Type 01h), 
disengaging thermal throttling, and exiting event 
injection.

active Thermal Throttle Engaged Event Injection, 
then injecting this event has no effect.

and performing an emergency shutdown of the 
controller.

shall_sentence:
PCI-2 
The device shall support modification of PCIe TLP completion timeout range as defined by 
the PCI Express Base Specification.

PCI-3 
The vendor shall disclose the vendor-specific timeout range definition in the “Completion 
Timeout Ranges Supported” field in the PCI Express Base Specification.

PCI-4 
The device shall support disabling PCIe Completion Timeout.

The device shall perform a PCIe Fundamental Reset when PERST# is asserted, and main 
power has not been removed even if firmware is hung.
after_shall:
The device firmware shall initialize when PERST# is de-asserted, regardless of whether the 
device firmware was hung when PERST# was asserted.

shall_sentence:
The device firmware shall initialize when PERST# is de-asserted, regardless of whether the 
device firmware was hung when PERST# was asserted.
before_shall:
The device shall perform a PCIe Fundamental Reset when PERST# is asserted, and main 
power has not been removed even if firmware is hung.

shall_sentence:
PCI-6 
PCIe Function Level Reset shall be supported.

PCI-8 
The device shall not expose a BAR4 or a BAR5 if neither CMB nor PMR is supported.

PCI-9 
The device shall support MSI-X.

PCI-10 
The MSI-X table shall reside in BAR0.

PCI-11 
If implemented, the MSI capability structure in configuration space shall be 4-byte aligned.

PCI-12 
Any optional PCI features supported by the device not described in this document shall be 
clearly documented and disclosed to the customer.

PCI-13 
The device shall support Completion Timeout Ranges A, B and C.

PCI-14 
The device shall support Relaxed Ordering.

The device shall not set the Relaxed Ordering bit in transactions it initiates as a Requester 
that require strong ordering (i.e., transactions that would violate the NVMe protocol or 
result in data corruption if re-ordered shall clear the Relaxed Ordering bit to 0b).
after_shall:
For 
example, the Enable Relaxed Ordering bit in transactions initiated by the device as a 
Requester shall be cleared to 0b in MSI/MSI-X writes, writes to the Completion Queue Entry, 
etc.

shall_sentence:
For 
example, the Enable Relaxed Ordering bit in transactions initiated by the device as a 
Requester shall be cleared to 0b in MSI/MSI-X writes, writes to the Completion Queue Entry, 
etc.
before_shall:
The device shall not set the Relaxed Ordering bit in transactions it initiates as a Requester 
that require strong ordering (i.e., transactions that would violate the NVMe protocol or 
result in data corruption if re-ordered shall clear the Relaxed Ordering bit to 0b).

shall_sentence:
PCI-16 
The device shall set the Relaxed Ordering bit in data DMAs, if Relaxed Ordering is enabled.

The device shall support all link speeds between the lowest link speed and the highest link 
speed, inclusive (e.g., a device compliant with the PCI Express Base Specification Revision 
6.2  shall support link speeds of 2.5 GT/s, 5.0 GT/s, 8 GT/S, 16 GT/s, 32 GT/s, and 64 GT/s).

PCI-18 
The device shall not require Device Specific Initialization (DSI).

PCI-19 
The device shall not perform a soft reset when transitioning from D3hot to D0 (i.e., 
No_Soft_Reset bit in the Power Management Control/Status Register shall be set to 1b).

PCI-20 
The device shall not support BARs that map to I/O Space.

PCI-21 
All BARs that map to Memory Space shall be 64-bit capable (i.e., bits 2:1 of the BAR shall be 
set to 10b) and shall support the full 64-bit address space.

The sum of the size of all BARs for a single non-SR-IOV function or SR-IOV Physical Function 
that maps to Memory Space shall be less than or equal to 1 MiB if neither CMB nor PMR is 
supported.

PCI-23 
The device shall require a maximum of one PCI bus number (e.g., no PCIe switches are 
allowed).

PCI-24 
The device’s DMA engines shall support the full 64-bit address space with uniform 
performance across the entire address range.

The Device Serial Number Extended Capability shall be supported except for virtual 
functions.
after_shall:
All functions on all ports of a device that implement this capability shall return 
the same serial number value.

shall_sentence:
All functions on all ports of a device that implement this capability shall return 
the same serial number value.
before_shall:
The Device Serial Number Extended Capability shall be supported except for virtual 
functions.
after_shall:
The serial number shall be unique for each device and 
independent from all other unique identifiers on the device (e.g., for namespaces, 
controllers, etc.).

shall_sentence:
The serial number shall be unique for each device and 
independent from all other unique identifiers on the device (e.g., for namespaces, 
controllers, etc.).
before_shall:
All functions on all ports of a device that implement this capability shall return 
the same serial number value.

shall_sentence:
PCI-26 
The device shall support the Advanced Error Reporting Extended Capability.

The device shall silently discard (following normal data link layer processing) without logging 
or signaling an error, any PCIe VDMs targeting a Function while it is in Function Level Reset 
(FLR).
after_shall:
When an FLR is initiated for a Function, any already-received PCIe VDMs still being 
processed by that Function shall be silently discarded.

shall_sentence:
When an FLR is initiated for a Function, any already-received PCIe VDMs still being 
processed by that Function shall be silently discarded.
before_shall:
The device shall silently discard (following normal data link layer processing) without logging 
or signaling an error, any PCIe VDMs targeting a Function while it is in Function Level Reset 
(FLR).
after_shall:
This requirement prohibits non-silent-discard behavior during an FLR that is allowed by the 
PCI Express Base Specification.

shall_sentence:
PCI-28 
The device shall support Address Translation Services (ATS).

While any one or more Functions on the device are in the D3hot power state, MCTP over 
PCIe VDM processing shall be fully operational and the device shall not generate errors for 
valid MCTP over PCIe VDMs received while in this state.
after_shall:
For example, while in this state, the 
device shall be able to successfully process MCTP over PCIe VDM requests, transmit the 
response, and shall be able to transmit MCTP messages for any asynchronous events that 
occur and are enabled.

shall_sentence:
For example, while in this state, the 
device shall be able to successfully process MCTP over PCIe VDM requests, transmit the 
response, and shall be able to transmit MCTP messages for any asynchronous events that 
occur and are enabled.
before_shall:
While any one or more Functions on the device are in the D3hot power state, MCTP over 
PCIe VDM processing shall be fully operational and the device shall not generate errors for 
valid MCTP over PCIe VDMs received while in this state.
after_shall: This requirement applies to all supported MCTP message types (e.g., NVMe-MI, SPDM, etc.).

shall_sentence:
PCIe non-Fundamental Resets (e.g., Function Level Reset, hot reset, or reset due to a link 
down/link disabled condition) shall not clear the device’s captured PCIe bus number(s) or 
MCTP Endpoint ID(s).
after_shall:
This is required so that devices can continue to communicate via 
MCTP over PCIe VDM following these types of resets without having to be re-initialized.

shall_sentence:
PCIe Fundamental Resets shall clear the captured PCIe bus number(s) as required by the PCI 
Express Base Specification and shall clear the MCTP Endpoint ID(s) as required by the MCTP 
PCIe Transport Binding Specification.

If an MCTP over PCIe VDM would otherwise signal Unsupported Request (e.g., ID Routed 
Message targeting a Function that is not implemented) is received, then the device shall 
silently discard that message.

In addition to responding to Broadcast from Root Complex as required by the MCTP PCIe 
VDM Binding Specification, a PCIe VDM Management Endpoint shall respond to Route by ID 
Message Requests for the following MCTP control messages:
PERST# shall not be treated as a power cycle.
after_shall: For example, PERST#:

shall_sentence:
• 
shall not cause TCG Opal devices to go to the Read Locked/Write Locked state (i.e., 
PERST# maps to the TCG reset type of Hardware Reset, not a Power Cycle, as 
defined by the TCG Storage Interface Interactions Specification) if the host has not 
configured a TCG HW Reset as one of the Reset Types that can lock the device’s 
locking ranges on LockOnReset in addition to Power Cycle; and 
• 
shall not cause commands prohibited via the NVMe Lockdown command to be un-
prohibited.
key_phrases: shall not cause commands prohibited via the NVMe Lockdown command

shall_sentence:
PCI-34 
PERST# shall not cause RW1CS bits defined by the PCI Express Base Specification (e.g., bits 
in the Uncorrectable Error Status and Correctable Error Status registers) to be cleared.
key_phrases: Uncorrectable Error Status and Correctable Error Status register

shall_sentence:
PCI-35 
The device shall not support either the D1 or the D2 power management states.

If any power-of-two-sized access, up to 8-bytes in size, to the memory pointed to by any of 
the NVMe device's BARs (e.g., access to controller registers) is aligned to a power-of-two 
boundary equal to the size of the access (e.g., a 2-byte access aligned to a 2-byte boundary, 
a 4-byte access aligned to a 4-byte boundary, etc.), then the access shall not be considered a 
restricted programming model violation (i.e., the access shall be processed successfully 
unless some other error unrelated to a restricted programming model violation is 
encountered).
after_shall:
Support is optional for any accesses greater than 8-bytes in size to the memory pointed to 
by NVMe BAR0/BAR1 (e.g., access to controller registers).

shall_sentence:
For any access that results in a restricted programming model violation, the request shall be 
handled as an Unsupported Request or Completer Abort as permitted for restricted 
programming model violations as defined by the PCI Express Base Specification (e.g., the 
device firmware shall not hang due to a restricted programming model violation).
before_shall:
The restricted programming 
model for the memory pointed to by BARs other than BAR0/BAR1 may support additional 
access sizes as required by the device vendor.

shall_sentence:
If the device receives an MCTP over PCIe VDM that is invalid due to an MCTP base layer 
error or MCTP message-type layer (e.g., NVMe-MI, SPDM) error, then the error shall be 
reported, if possible, at the MCTP base layer or MCTP message-type layer respectively; 
otherwise, the invalid MCTP over PCIe VDM shall be silently discarded.

A Function Level Reset to a Function other than the Function associated with the MCTP 
endpoint shall have no impact on MCTP traffic on the Function associated with the MCTP 
endpoint.

The device shall perform a PCIe Conventional Reset per the PCI Express Base Specification 
(e.g., resetting PCIe-defined state machines, setting PCIe-defined registers to default, etc.) 
when main power has not been removed and any of the following conditions occur, even if 
the firmware is not functioning (e.g., has asserted or is otherwise non-responsive):

The device shall comply with PCI-SIG requirements for supported TLP sizes, including 
support for TLP writes to PRP memory addresses with 64-byte alignment and 64-byte 
granularity.

PCI-41 
MCTP over PCIe VDM shall be supported by PCIe Function 0 on each port and shall not be 
supported by any other PCIe Function.

PCI-42 
For PCIe Gen6 devices, L0p shall be supported.

BOOT-1 
The device shall support the UEFI 2.0 and all later versions of the Tianocore EDKII NVMe 
driver.

BOOT-2 
The device shall neither support nor include an option ROM.

LPWR-1 
ASPM shall be disabled after a power cycle or PCIe resets as defined by the PCI Express Base 
Specification.

LPWR-2 
The device shall support the PCIe ASPM L1 power state.

Measurement log page as an input and decodes the Eye Data field of each lane in the log 
page.

section.

additional fields related to this are supported with each event type (FDP Event Flags, PID, 
NSID, Reclaim Group Identifier, Reclaim Unit Handle Identifier, etc.)

FDPSRG-1 
The number of advertised reclaim groups (NRG) shall be 1.

FDPSRG-2 
The device shall support a minimum of 8 reclaim unit handles.

FDPSRG-3 
The device shall set Volatile Write Cache Present to 0b (not supported).

FDPSRG-4 
The device shall support an FDP configuration with a minimum of 8 reclaim unit handles of 
Reclaim Unit Handle Type Initially Isolated.

FDPSRG-6 
Single reclaim group configurations shall support a minimum of 8 namespaces.

FDPSRG-7 
Single reclaim group configurations shall support SECTOR-4 and DIX-1 in an FDP 
configuration.

FDPSRG2-1 
The device shall support all the requirements in FDP Single Reclaim Group Configuration 1 
section 6.1.2 except FDPSRG-4.

FDPSRG2-2 
The device shall support an FDP configuration with a minimum of 8 reclaim unit handles of 
Reclaim Unit Handle Type Persistently Isolated.

FDPDP-1 
The number of advertised reclaim groups (NRG) shall match the number of flash dies in the 
NVM subsystem.

FDPDP-2 
The configuration shall support a minimum of 8 reclaim unit handles.
