The device shall support an Uncorrectable Bit Error Rate (UBER) of < 1 sector per 1018 bits 
read.
after_shall:
Physical device testing is only required to demonstrate an Uncorrectable Bit Error 
Rate (UBER) of < 1 sector per 1017 bits read (as per JESD218B method).

shall_sentence:
The device shall be able to process the Identify command with a successful completion 
within 1 second of CC.EN being set to 1b provided a Shutdown is not in progress when 
CC.EN is set to 1b.
after_shall: Some models may allow a longer time (see Section 13 Device Profiles).
key_phrases: The device shall be able to process the Identify command

shall_sentence:
The device shall be able to process I/O and Admin commands that require access to media 
with a successful completion within 20 seconds after CC.EN has been set to 1b.
after_shall:
Some 
models require a different time (see Section 13 Device Profiles).

shall_sentence:
The device shall be able to process Admin commands with a successful completion as soon 
as CSTS.RDY = 1.
after_shall:
Slower processing of Admin commands that require media access is 
acceptable while the media is becoming ready.
key_phrases: The device shall be able to process Admin command

shall_sentence: The device shall keep CSTS.RDY = 0 until the device is able to process Admin commands.
after_shall:
Some models may have additional requirements before CSTS.RDY can be set to 1 (see 
Section 13 Device Profiles).
key_phrases: until the device is able to process Admin command

shall_sentence:
TTR-5 
The Shutdown Notification completion (i.e., the CSTS.SHST set to 10b) shall be received 
within 10 seconds after the start of a normal shutdown (i.e., after CC.SHN is set to 01b).

TTR-6 
The device shall support both the CC.SHN Normal and Abrupt Shutdown Notifications.

TTR-7 
After a normal shutdown is completed successfully, the device shall not enter a 
rebuild/recovery mode on the next power on.

A normal shutdown shall trigger flushing to non-volatile memory of any content within the 
device’s internal cache(s) (e.g., SRAM/DRAM), if present, which is required to be non-
volatile.

TTR-12 
Metadata rebuild due to any reason (e.g., unexpected power loss) shall not exceed 120 
seconds and the device shall meet its latency requirements after this.

TTR-16 
Any shutdown event shall not make the device non-functional under any conditions.

When the CC.SHN register is written to notify the device to shut down it shall not be 
assumed that power will be lost even after CC.EN is cleared to 0.
after_shall:
Under these conditions 
the device shall continue to function properly based on the NVMe and PCIe Specifications.

shall_sentence:
Under these conditions 
the device shall continue to function properly based on the NVMe and PCIe Specifications.
before_shall:
When the CC.SHN register is written to notify the device to shut down it shall not be 
assumed that power will be lost even after CC.EN is cleared to 0.

shall_sentence:
TTR-20 
The device shall be able to successfully respond to Configuration space accesses within 1s 
from de-assertion of PERST#.

Upon completion of a PCIe Conventional Reset, the device shall start initializing the media 
and within 20 seconds from the completion of the PCIe Conventional Reset shall be able to 
successfully process: 
in-band I/O and Admin commands requiring media access, assuming CC.EN has been set to 
1b; and 
out-of-band Admin commands requiring media access, including prior to the in-band host 
enabling the controller.
after_shall:
Some models require a different time (see Section 13 Device Profiles) 
If a PCIe Conventional Reset occurs while a device is shutdown (i.e., the CSTS.SHST field is 
set to 10b), then this requirement may cause the device to transition to a state where a 
power loss would be unexpected.

shall_sentence:
TTR-23 
The device shall not support NVM Subsystem Shutdown.

INCS-1 
When the power-loss protection mechanism fails for any reason while power is applied, the 
device shall:

INCS-2 
The device shall incorporate a shutdown checksum or flag as the very last piece of data 
written to flash to detect incomplete shutdown.

INCS-3 
The checksum or flag in INCS-2 shall be used on power-up to confirm that the previous 
shutdown was 100% successful.

An incomplete/unsuccessful shutdown that causes the device to be unable to guarantee 
data/metadata integrity shall result in an increase in the Incomplete Shutdowns field 
(SMART-15) in the SMART / Health Information Extended log page (Log Identifier C0h).
after_shall:
on 
the subsequent power up, the device shall set bit 3 of the Critical Warning field in the

If the device is in read-only mode (i.e., bit 3 in the Critical Warning field is set to 1b in the 
SMART / Health Information log page (Log Identifier 02h)) for any reason, then the device 
shall still support NVMe Admin commands, including commands that result in a purge (see 
SEC-43).

If the Error Recovery log page (Log Identifier C1h) is supported, when the device increments

All user data and metadata shall be protected using overlapping protection mechanisms 
throughout the entire read and write path in the device including all storage elements 
(registers, caches, SRAM, DRAM, NAND, etc.).

This shall 
be for all memories regardless of function.
before_shall:
E2E-2 
At least one bit of correction and 2 bits of detection is required for all memories.

shall_sentence:
The entire DRAM addressable space shall be protected with at least one-bit correction and 2 
bits of detection scheme (SECDED).
after_shall: This includes but is not limited to the following:

shall_sentence:
E2E-4 
Silent data corruption shall not be tolerated under any circumstances.

The device shall include a mechanism to protect against returning the data from the wrong 
logical block address (LBA), including previous copies from the same LBA, to the host.
after_shall:
It is 
acceptable if the device stores additional/modified information to provide protection 
against returning wrong data to the host.

shall_sentence:
Device shall perform host LBA integrity checking 
on all transfers to and from the media.
before_shall:
It is 
acceptable if the device stores additional/modified information to provide protection 
against returning wrong data to the host.

shall_sentence:
E2E-6 
All device metadata, firmware, firmware variables, and other device system data shall be 
protected by at least a single bit detection scheme.

E2E-7 
Any memory buffers that are utilized to accelerate data transfer (read-ahead buffers for 
example) shall follow the protection scheme outlined in E2E-5.

While the device is in a failed state in which it can no longer accept Write commands (e.g., 
firmware crash, error, or assert), the device shall allow read access only if it can guarantee 
data integrity.
key_phrases: While the device is in a failed state in which it can no longer accept Write command

shall_sentence:
While the device is in a failed state, that is not a controller failure (e.g., firmware crash, HW 
error, or assert), the device shall still support NVMe Admin commands including the ability 
to read any failure logs from the device to determine the nature of the failure.
after_shall:
After a controller failure, the device may fail Admin commands sent by the host prior to 
completion of the Error Reset Action in the Error Recovery workflow (see EREC-2).
key_phrases: the device may fail Admin command
the device shall still support NVMe Admin command

shall_sentence:
Upon device completion of the actions specified in Error Reset Action (see EREC-2) and 
Device Recovery Action (see EREC-3), if the device is successfully recovered from a failed 
state, then the device shall function normally as specified in this specification including read 
and write access at full performance.

The device shall have a mechanism (e.g., watchdog timer) to allow recovery from hangs of 
the firmware and hardware.
after_shall:

seconds.

shall_sentence:
The timeout interval of this mechanism shall be less than 2 
seconds.

shall_sentence:
The device shall meet an MTBF of 2.5 million hours (AFR of <= 0.35% per JEDEC JESD 218) 
under the following environmental conditions:

REL-2 
The device shall meet an MTBF of 2.0 million hours (AFR of <= 0.44% per JEDEC JESD 218) 
under the following environmental conditions:

REL-3 
The vendor shall provide the temperature conditions used to determine the MTBF.

REL-4 
The vendor shall provide AFR de-rating curves for the Temperature range shown in 
requirement REL-2 for up to 70°C (158˚°F).

The AFR targets in REL-1 (MTBF of 2.5 million hours) and REL-2 (MTBF of 2.0 million hours) 
shall be maintained up to a continuous reported composite temperature of 77°C (170°F) 
(WCTEMP) with less than 1% of the device power on time above WCTEMP.

fingers, etc.

shall_sentence:
BKGND-1 
The device shall support background data refresh while the device is powered on to ensure 
there is no data-loss due to power-on retention issues.

BKGND-2 
The device shall be designed and tested to support the normal NAND operating 
temperature.

BKGND-3 
Background data refresh shall cover the entire device and be designed to continuously run 
in the background and not just during idle periods.

The device shall utilize the entire Endurance Group media capacity range whenever the 
device needs to wear-level a block.
after_shall:
The device shall not restrict the wear-leveling range to a 
subset of the Endurance Group media capacity unless otherwise specified.

subset of the Endurance Group media capacity unless otherwise specified.

device needs to wear-level a block.

shall_sentence:
PLP-1 
The device shall support full power-loss protection for all acknowledged data and metadata.

PLP-2 
The Power-loss protection health check shall not impact I/O latency and performance.

PLP-3 
Power-loss protection health check shall be performed by the device at power-on (prior to 
accepting any writes) and at least once every time interval as specified in SPLPI-13.

PLP-4 
While performing the power-loss protection health check, the device shall still have enough 
energy to be able to handle an abrupt power loss properly.

The firmware/hardware algorithm shall deploy safeguards to prevent false detection of 
power loss protection failure.
after_shall:
Example of a false detection would be a glitch in any of the 
power loss circuitry readings which would cause a transient event to trigger a false power 
loss protection failure when the power loss protection hardware is healthy.

shall_sentence:
The device shall implement a power-loss protection (PLP) health check which can detect the 
capacitor holdup energy margin reported in the Capacitor Health field specified in SMART-
19 in SMART / Heath Information Extended log page (Log Identifier C0h).
after_shall:
The PLP health 
check shall not just check for open/short capacitor conditions but shall measure the true 
available margin energy.

shall_sentence:
The PLP health 
check shall not just check for open/short capacitor conditions but shall measure the true 
available margin energy.

to violate REL-1 or REL-2.

The device documentation shall include the number of physical bytes able to be written to 
the device assuming a write amplification of 1.

The Percentage Used in the SMART / Heath Information log page (Log Identifier 02h) shall 
track linearly with bytes written and at 100% it shall match the EOL value specified in 
ENDUD-1.

Non-Operational (Powered-off) device data retention time (end of life) shall be at least 1 
month at 40°C (104°F).

For purposes of this 
requirement, the assumption is that the Terabytes Written (TBW) capability of the devices is

The device shall not throttle its performance based on the endurance metric (endurance

(Temperature Threshold), if that event is enabled and an Asynchronous Event Request 
command is outstanding.

The temperature limits of internal components within the device shall govern the thermal 
throttling algorithms.
after_shall:
In addition, the thermal throttling algorithms shall prevent excessive 
case temperature (see TTHROTTLE-14).

shall_sentence:
In addition, the thermal throttling algorithms shall prevent excessive 
case temperature (see TTHROTTLE-14).
before_shall:
The temperature limits of internal components within the device shall govern the thermal 
throttling algorithms.

shall_sentence:
In all throttling states including the lowest throttle state, the device shall not enter a read-
only mode and shall continue to attempt to process all commands, including commands 
that write media, unless the device shuts down, e.g., due to a Critical Temperature 
condition.
key_phrases: only mode and shall continue to attempt to process all command

shall_sentence:
The critical device case (i.e., touch) temperature shall be the TS2 limits as specified in IEC 
62368-1 3rd Edition or later.
after_shall:
For non-case devices the hottest surface shall be used for the 
device touch temperature.

shall_sentence:
For non-case devices the hottest surface shall be used for the 
device touch temperature.

The critical device case (i.e., touch) temperature shall be the TS2 limits as specified in IEC 
62368-1 3rd Edition or later.

13).

shall_sentence:
TRPT-1 
The device shall expose the current raw sensor readings from all the sensors on the device.

A device shall report a composite temperature that has an accuracy better than or equal to 
+/-1°C (1.8°F) degrees.
after_shall:
As a consequence, two devices of the same model shall not report a 
composite temperature greater than 2°C (3.6°F) apart under the same environmental 
conditions, slot location, and workload.

shall_sentence:
As a consequence, two devices of the same model shall not report a 
composite temperature greater than 2°C (3.6°F) apart under the same environmental 
conditions, slot location, and workload.
before_shall:
A device shall report a composite temperature that has an accuracy better than or equal to 
+/-1°C (1.8°F) degrees.

shall_sentence:
TRPT-3 
A device shall use temperature sensors that have an accuracy better than or equal to +/-1°C 
(1.8°F) degrees.

TRPT-4 
The vendor shall provide the customer the equation, settings, and thresholds used to 
calculate the composite temperature.

TRPT-5 
When calculating the composite temperature, the device shall take into account the 
temperature of all of the major thermal components (SOC, DRAM, NAND, PMIC, etc.).

TRPT-6 
The reported composite temperature shall be the same for all controllers in the NVM 
subsystem.

The device shall shut down to protect itself against data loss or damage due to extreme 
temperatures.
after_shall:
The shutdown temperature value shall be at a composite temperature of 
85°C (185°F).

shall_sentence:
The shutdown temperature value shall be at a composite temperature of 
85°C (185°F).
before_shall:
The device shall shut down to protect itself against data loss or damage due to extreme 
temperatures.
after_shall: Shutdown shall preserve all user data.

shall_sentence: Shutdown shall preserve all user data.
before_shall:
The shutdown temperature value shall be at a composite temperature of 
85°C (185°F).

shall_sentence: The device shall not process NVM I/O commands while in thermal shutdown.

If it is safe to 
do so, the device shall process Admin commands (in-band and out-of-band), NVMe-MI 
Command Set commands, and PCIe Command Set commands while in thermal shutdown.

Set commands while in thermal shutdown

shall_sentence:
THRMS-3 
The device shall only come out of thermal shutdown as a result of a main power cycle or 
PWRDIS cycling internal device power.

GFF-1 
The device shall be compliant to PCI Express Base Specification, Revision 5.0, Version 1.0 (or 
later).

GFF-2 
The vendor shall provide a PCIe compliance report that demonstrates compliance.

The device shall support lane reversal with all lanes connected or partially connected lanes 
on both the lower-numbered lanes and higher-numbered lanes of the device (e.g., a x4 
device shall support lane reversal for x4, x2, and x1 connections on both the lower-
numbered lanes and higher-numbered lanes of the device).

The device shall train to x1 when the upstream device provides only one lane, to x2 when 2 
lanes are provided and to x4 when 4 lanes are provided.
after_shall:
This requirement applies to both 
the lower-numbered lanes and higher-numbered lanes of the device.

shall_sentence:
GFF-5 
The device shall support hot swap on form factors that support hot swap.

GFF-6 
A CAD file of each supported form factor shall be provided to the customer.

The device Max Average Power (MAP) consumption for any workload shall not exceed the 
Maximum Power (MP) of the current NVMe Power State measured over a 1 second window 
with a sampling rate of 2 ms or less.
after_shall:
The measurement duration shall be at least 15 minutes 
on a pre-conditioned device.

shall_sentence:
The measurement duration shall be at least 15 minutes 
on a pre-conditioned device.
before_shall:
The device Max Average Power (MAP) consumption for any workload shall not exceed the 
Maximum Power (MP) of the current NVMe Power State measured over a 1 second window 
with a sampling rate of 2 ms or less.
after_shall:
This requirement defines the measurement methodology for 
Maximum Sustained Device Power as defined in SFF-TA-1009 revision 3.0.

shall_sentence:
The device peak power for any workload shall be measured over a 100 uS window with a 
sampling interval of 4 uS or less.
after_shall:
The measurement duration shall be at least 15 minutes on 
a pre-conditioned device.

shall_sentence:
The measurement duration shall be at least 15 minutes on 
a pre-conditioned device.
before_shall:
The device peak power for any workload shall be measured over a 100 uS window with a 
sampling interval of 4 uS or less.

shall_sentence:
For devices whose max average power consumption is less than or equal to 25 W, the peak 
power shall be no more than 1.5x the max average power.
after_shall:
For devices whose max average 
power consumption is greater than 25 W but less than or equal to 29W the peak power 
shall be no more than 37.5 W.

For devices whose max average 
power consumption is greater than 25 W but less than or equal to 29W the peak power 
shall be no more than 37.5 W.

For devices whose max average 
power consumption is greater than 25 W but less than or equal to 29W the peak power

after_shall:

max average power is defined in PCM-1.

shall_sentence:
The Maximum Power field in each NVMe Power State Descriptor data structure in the 
Identify Controller data structure shall indicate (for the described power state) the 
maximum allowed value of the device Max Average Power (MAP) where MAP is measured 
as specified by PCM-1.

The Power Management (Feature Identifier 02h) shall be supported and the NVMe Power 
State Descriptor table in Identify Controller Data Structure bytes 3071:2048 shall be filled 
out per the NVM Express Base Specification.

Power state entries above the maximum rated power envelope of the device shall not be 
populated in the NVMe Power State Descriptor table in Identify Controller Data Structure 
bytes 3071:2048.

The Set Features for Power Management (Feature Identifier 02h) with the SV bit 31 in 
Command Dword 10 shall be supported so that the power level can be set and will be saved 
across power cycles.

The device, regardless of form factor or capacity, shall have an idle power of 5 W or less per 
European Lot 9 regulation without use of the Idle Wake Up Time Configuration Feature (see 
Section 4.15.21 Idle Wake Up Time Configuration (Feature Identifier CAh) Set Features).
after_shall:
Devices shall automatically reduce power consumption to 5 W or less when idle without 
impacting latency or performance.

shall_sentence:
Devices shall automatically reduce power consumption to 5 W or less when idle without 
impacting latency or performance.

The device shall not consume more power than the PCI-SIG Slot Capabilities register Slot 
Power Limit regardless of other settings (e.g., DSSD Power State, NVMe Power State).

PWR-8 
The device shall not use the same Maximum Power (MP) value in more than one supported 
NVMe Power State Descriptor unless otherwise specified.

The device shall not support Non-Operational Power State Permissive Mode (i.e., bit 1 of 
the Controller Attributes field in the Identify Controller data structure shall be cleared to 
0b).

shall_sentence:
The device shall support NVM Express Management Interface Specification, Revision 2.0 or 
later, including all mandatory requirements.

compliance report that demonstrates compliance.

shall_sentence:
The device shall support all NVMe-MI functionality required by this specification over 
SMBus, even when the PCIe link is not active (as required by the NVM Express Management 
Interface Specification).

NVMe-MI-3 
The device shall support NVMe-MI over PCIe VDM (see NVMe-MI-1).

NVMe-MI-4 
The device shall support SMBus Fixed and Discoverable.

NVMe-MI-5 
The device shall NACK any SMBus addresses not listed in the NVM Express Management 
Interface Specification.

NVMe-MI-6 
The device shall support the Get UDID command per the SMBus Specification.
key_phrases: The device shall support the Get UDID command

shall_sentence:
All mandatory NVMe Admin commands and the following optional NVMe Admin commands 
shall be supported by MCTP over SMBus, and by MCTP over PCIe VDM.
key_phrases: All mandatory NVMe Admin commands and the following optional NVMe Admin command

shall_sentence:
All mandatory Log Identifiers, all Log Identifiers defined in this specification, and the 
following optional Log Identifiers shall be supported by MCTP over SMBus, and by MCTP 
over PCIe VDM.

All mandatory Feature Identifiers, all Feature Identifiers defined in this specification, and the 
following Feature Identifiers shall be supported by MCTP over SMBus, and by MCTP over 
PCIe VDM.

The device shall support locking down all supported Admin commands and all supported 
Features on the in-band interface via a Lockdown command issued out-of-band via MCTP 
over SMBus, and by MCTP over PCIe VDM.
after_shall:
This includes the Lockdown command itself, and 
all Admin commands and Features not referenced in this specification.
key_phrases: band interface via a Lockdown command
The device shall support locking down all supported Admin command

shall_sentence:
NVMe-MI-16 
Access to user data is prohibited via out-of-band NVMe-MI (e.g., vendor-specific commands 
shall not access user data).

NVMe-MI-17 
The device shall support SMBus/I2C Frequencies of 100 KHz and 400 KHz.

NVMe-MI-18 
For SMBus, the device shall support all possible MCTP Transmission Unit Size values up to 
the largest (250 bytes).

NVMe-MI-19 
For PCIe VDM, the NVMe device shall support all possible MCTP Transmission Unit Size 
values up to the PCIe Max Payload Size Supported.

NVMe devices shall support a minimum throughput of 50 MiB/s for data transfer in each 
direction over the MCTP over PCIe VDM interface under the assumptions that:

Any TCG method invoked via NVMe-MI that takes longer than 100 ms shall run in the 
background using the OutstandingData mechanism (preferred) or the More Processing 
Required mechanism.

NVMe-MI-22 
The device shall support NVMe-MI over SPDM Secured Messages (see SPDM-7).

The device shall support the following Asynchronous Event Messages per TP6035a and shall 
support the following Asynchronous Events:

If the device is in SMBus mode, and the SMBus clock is low for longer than tTIMEOUT,MIN (refer 
to the SMBus Specification), then the device shall perform SMBus clock-low recovery even if 
firmware is hung.
after_shall:
Refer to section 4.2.2 of the SMBus specification version 3.3.1 – the 
behavior that is “highly recommended” (including the communication interface reset) is 
mandatory in this specification.

shall_sentence:
NVMe-MI-25 
The device shall support retrieval of log pages greater than 4 KiB as required by the NVM 
Express Management Interface Specification.

For devices that support auxiliary power, the device shall be fully functional including 
NVMe-MI over SMBus/I2C as long as main power is present even if auxiliary power is 
absent.

For form factors that support I3C, the device shall support I3C Basic Specification v1.1.1 as 
specified in the NVM Express Management Interface Specification and SFF-TA-1009 
Enterprise and Datacenter Standard Form Factor Pin and Signal Specification.

The device shall support the PCIe Configuration Write command for a single-byte-sized PCIe 
Configuration Write to the Power Management Control/Status Register (Offset 04h) in the 
PCI Power Management Capability Structure.

other than the Power Management Control/Status Register and PCIe Configuration Writes 
that access any byte offset other than 4h (e.g., a multi-byte write that starts at offset 4h) 
shall be aborted with a status code of Access Denied.

The device shall support multiple NVMe-MI Management Endpoints per 2-wire port (i.e., 
I2C or I3C port) via MCTP bridging for Endpoint Identifier assignment so that multiple 
Management Controllers are able to manage the device via NVMe-MI.

This device support 
for multiple Management Endpoints shall include support for TP6034a, which is included in 
NVMe-MI 2.0, see NVMe-MI-1.

Management Controllers are able to manage the device via NVMe-MI.
after_shall:
If the device is unable to use MCTP bridging for Endpoint Identifier assignment on a 2-wire 
port (e.g., because the device is unable to obtain Endpoint Identifiers for MCTP bridging to 
assign to multiple NVMe-MI Management Endpoints), then the device shall use a single 
NVMe-MI Management Endpoint for that 2-wire port.

shall_sentence:
The device shall support XTS-AES-256 (as specified in NIST SP 800-38E, which references 
IEEE STD 1619) or AES-256-GCM (as specified in NIST SP 800-38D) hardware-based data 
encryption for performance and to prevent firmware tampering with the encryption 
mechanism.
after_shall: AES-256-GCM is the preferred mode.

shall_sentence: The device shall support anti-rollback protection for firmware.
after_shall:
If the Security Version 
Number (see SMART-22) of the firmware being committed or activated is greater or equal to 
the Security Version Number of the currently running firmware, then the firmware is 
allowed to be committed or activated.

shall_sentence:
If the Security Version Number of the firmware being 
committed or activated is less than the Security Version Number of the currently running 
firmware, then the firmware shall not be committed or activated.
before_shall:
If the Security Version 
Number (see SMART-22) of the firmware being committed or activated is greater or equal to 
the Security Version Number of the currently running firmware, then the firmware is 
allowed to be committed or activated.
after_shall:
If firmware activation occurs as a result of a power cycle, then the term “currently running 
firmware” in this requirement refers to the firmware that was running immediately prior to 
that power cycle.

shall_sentence:
SEC-4 
The device shall support Crypto Erase (see NVMe-AD-5) and NVMe-AD-7).

SEC-5 
The device shall support Secure Boot (see Section 12.2 Secure Boot).

SEC-6 
The device shall have a method of identifying a secure boot failure which does not require 
physical access to the device.

SEC-7 
The device’s cryptographic module shall be FIPS 140-3 level 2 capable per CMVP and shall 
follow the NIST 800-90 (A, B and C) specification.

SEC-8 
The device shall only implement NIST approved cryptographic algorithms and shall be 
designed to achieve FIPS-140-3 validation (see SEC-7).

The device shall support key revocation allowing a new key to be used for firmware 
verification.
after_shall:
The device shall support at least 4 key revocations, and key revocation shall not 
make the device unbootable (i.e., the device supports at least 5 keys).

The device shall support at least 4 key revocations, and key revocation shall not 
make the device unbootable (i.e., the device supports at least 5 keys).

verification.

TCG devices shall support the IEEE1667 Probe (100h) and the TCG Storage Transport (104h) 
silos.
after_shall: See SEC-50 and SEC-51 for additional IEEE1667 requirements.

shall_sentence:
The vendor shall follow the Security Development Lifecycle (SDL), and provide a report with 
the following for each qualification-ready or production-ready firmware version:

A firmware audit of the initial firmware released to customer intended for qualification and 
any subsequent firmware release intended for production use shall be performed using OCP 
SAFE, Framework v1.0 or later.
after_shall: A Scope 1 audit is the minimum requirement.

shall_sentence:
The detailed 
report for each firmware release delivered to the customer shall be provided to the 
customer.
before_shall: A Scope 1 audit is the minimum requirement.
after_shall:
The customer may choose to put the firmware release into production use ahead of the 
vendor delivering the completed SAFE audit results (e.g., deploy hotfix firmware before the 
incremental SAFE audit for that hotfix firmware is received).

shall_sentence:
SEC-16 
All signing keys shall be stored in a Hardware Security Module (HSM) that is either FIPS 
140-2 Level 3 (or greater) certified or FIPS 140-3 Level 3 (or greater) certified.

The number of people with access and their corresponding roles 
shall be provided.
before_shall:
Access/use of signing keys should be restricted to a small set of developers, following the 
principle of least privilege.

The device shall not include user data, passwords, keys, or any secret or sensitive 
information in any Telemetry or debug log pages.

SEC-24 
All public keys shall be revocable.
Secure Boot Flow shall be based upon a hardware root of trust.

SEC-26 
The device shall only update firmware via a secure firmware update flow that shall be based 
upon immutable public keys.

The device shall purge all symmetric keys and all private asymmetric keys from volatile 
memory as soon as they are no longer needed for operation during the current power on 
state.

The device shall only store, even if temporarily, host provided passwords, host provided 
keys, or any host provided secret information in non-volatile memory in an encrypted form.

All telemetry and debug logs shall only be writable by device firmware that has been 
verified as part of a secure boot.

SEC-39 
The device shall not allow the host to read firmware or boot code from the device.

SEC-40 
All device firmware packages shall be encrypted based on a symmetric encryption 
algorithm.
after_shall: See SEC-2 for acceptable algorithms and SEC-29 for key storage requirements.

shall_sentence:
SEC-41 
If the device does not support Caliptra, the device shall only support activation of encrypted 
firmware images.

If the device does not support Caliptra, the device shall only store firmware in encrypted 
format when stored in non-volatile memory to protect against physical disassembly of drive 
to extract stored firmware from media.

Sanitize, Format NVM User Data Erase/Cryptographic Erase, and TCG 
Revert/RevertSP/GenKey functionality shall comply with the IEEE 2883-2022 Purge 
requirements.

Any command that changes the media encryption key(s) as part of its operation (e.g.,

Any optional security features supported by the device and not described in this document

TCG devices shall support the Security Receive and Security Send commands in-band (i.e.,

The Cryptographic Module Boundary 
shall include all relevant cryptographic functions within the boundary itself, such as the data 
at rest encryption algorithms per FIPS 197 and digital signature algorithms for firmware 
authentication per FIPS 186-5.

Module Boundary should be Non-Security Relevant.

that enables the host to obtain FIPS certification information that is associated with the 
Cryptographic Module, see SEC-52.

methods, logging operations (including debug outputs), and within externally accessible 
configuration files or settings.

shall_sentence:
A FIPS 140 device shall support retrieval of the FIPS 140 compliance descriptor for the active 
firmware via the Security Receive command with Security Protocol 00h and an SP Specific 
value of 0002h, as specified in the SFSC (Security Features for SCSI Commands) SCSI 
standard.
after_shall:
For a FIPS 140 validated device, the contents of the FIPS 140 compliance 
descriptor shall match the FIPS 140 certificate for that FIPS 140 device.
key_phrases:
compliance descriptor for the active 
firmware via the Security Receive command

shall_sentence:
For a FIPS 140 validated device, the contents of the FIPS 140 compliance 
descriptor shall match the FIPS 140 certificate for that FIPS 140 device.
before_shall:
A FIPS 140 device shall support retrieval of the FIPS 140 compliance descriptor for the active 
firmware via the Security Receive command with Security Protocol 00h and an SP Specific 
value of 0002h, as specified in the SFSC (Security Features for SCSI Commands) SCSI 
standard.
after_shall:
This requirement 
applies to all FIPS 140 devices, independent of whether or not the Cryptographic Module 
Boundary encompasses the entire physical device (see SEC-47).
key_phrases:
compliance descriptor for the active 
firmware via the Security Receive command

shall_sentence:
For a FIPS 140 device, the FIPS 140 compliance descriptor shall be populated with accurate 
and complete information reflecting the device’s FIPS 140 certification information in 
devices that are intended for customer qualification (i.e., Qualification Samples), production 
devices, and any device that has been submitted for FIPS 140 validation (see DCLP-13).
after_shall:
For a FIPS 140 device, the FIPS 140 compliance descriptor shall be populated with accurate 
and complete information reflecting the device’s FIPS 140 certification information in any 
device that is intended to be FIPS 140 validated, but has not yet been submitted for FIPS 140 
validation, e.g., Engineering Samples for which the expected contents of the FIPS 140 
compliance descriptor are known (see DCLP-13).

shall_sentence:
For a FIPS 140 device, the FIPS 140 compliance descriptor shall be populated with accurate 
and complete information reflecting the device’s FIPS 140 certification information in any 
device that is intended to be FIPS 140 validated, but has not yet been submitted for FIPS 140 
validation, e.g., Engineering Samples for which the expected contents of the FIPS 140 
compliance descriptor are known (see DCLP-13).
before_shall:
For a FIPS 140 device, the FIPS 140 compliance descriptor shall be populated with accurate 
and complete information reflecting the device’s FIPS 140 certification information in 
devices that are intended for customer qualification (i.e., Qualification Samples), production 
devices, and any device that has been submitted for FIPS 140 validation (see DCLP-13).
after_shall:
These requirements override any requirements in the SCSI SFSC standard to only populate 
the FIPS 140 compliance descriptor for a device that is FIPS 140 validated.

shall_sentence: The device shall support Secure Boot.
after_shall: There are two fundamental things to address for secure boot:

shall_sentence:
The device shall comply with the FIPS 186-5 Digital Signature Standard (DSS) and relevant 
NIST standards for PQC Digital Signatures (see SBT-4)  and the OCP Hardware Secure Boot 
v1.0 or later specification.
after_shall:
This requirement does not require implementation of the OCP Attestation of System 
Components specification.

shall_sentence:
SBT-2 
For Core Root of Trust measurement, each device shall have a Cryptographic Device Identity.

The TCG Hardware Requirements for a Device Identifier Composition Engine v1.0 R0.91 or 
later standard or an alternative hardware based cryptographic identity shall be 
implemented.

SBT-4 
The device shall implement at least one of the Digital Signature PQC algorithms as specified 
in the Commercial National Security Algorithm Suite 2.0 no later than 2025.

SBT-5 
Secure boot flow shall be immutable for exploitation and use immutable public keys.

The device shall comply with the Security Protocol and Data Model (SPDM) Specification, 
Version 1.4 or later.
after_shall:
The device shall be backwards compatible with the Security Protocol 
and Data Model (SPDM) Specification, Version 1.1 and later.

shall_sentence:
The device shall be backwards compatible with the Security Protocol 
and Data Model (SPDM) Specification, Version 1.1 and later.
before_shall:
The device shall comply with the Security Protocol and Data Model (SPDM) Specification, 
Version 1.4 or later.

shall_sentence:
SPDM-2 
The device shall comply with the revised PCI-SIG Component Measurement and 
Authentication (CMA-SPDM) ECN that was published on September 20, 2023.

SPDM-3 
The device shall support SPDM-1 and SPDM-2 via MCTP over SMBus/I2C.

SPDM-4 
The device shall support SPDM-1 and SPDM-2 via MCTP over PCIe VDM.

SPDM-5 
The device shall support SPDM-1 and SPDM-2 via PCI-SIG Data Object Exchange (DOE) 
Revision 1.1.

SPDM-7 
The device shall comply with the Secured Messages using SPDM over MCTP Binding 
Specification, Version 1.1.1 or later.

SPDM-8 
The device shall comply with the Secured Messages using SPDM Specification, Version 1.1.1 
or later.
after_shall: Mutual authentication is not required.

shall_sentence:
SPDM-9 
The device shall comply with the Security Protocol and Data Model (SPDM) over MCTP 
Binding Specification, Version 1.0.2 or later.

The device shall not drop the response if the device does not receive RESPOND_IF_READY 
within WTMax amount of time after sending an ERROR message with an ErrorCode equal to 
ResponseNotReady.

SPDM-11 
The device shall be ready to respond to SPDM requests within a maximum of 2 second after 
main power is applied.

SPDM-12 
The device’s SPDM MCTP interpacket delay shall be less than 40 ms.

The device shall have a unique and immutable hardware identity based on an asymmetric 
key pair, and DeviceCert that includes hardware identity information as defined in the SPDM 
Specification.

SPDM-14 
The device shall support a DataTransferSize of at least 4 KiB.
The device shall comply with the SPDM requirements in the following table:

The device shall comply with the CHALLENGE_AUTH response requirements in the following 
table:

Signature endianness shall follow the requirements in Security Protocol and Data Model 
(SPDM) Specification, Version 1.2.2 or later even in the case that an older SPDM version is 
supported by the device.
after_shall:
For example, on ECDSA signatures, the byte order for r and s shall 
be big endian order.

shall_sentence:
For example, on ECDSA signatures, the byte order for r and s shall 
be big endian order.
before_shall:
Signature endianness shall follow the requirements in Security Protocol and Data Model 
(SPDM) Specification, Version 1.2.2 or later even in the case that an older SPDM version is 
supported by the device.
after_shall:
When placing ECDSA signatures into an SPDM signature field, r shall 
come first, followed by s.

shall_sentence:
When placing ECDSA signatures into an SPDM signature field, r shall 
come first, followed by s.
before_shall:
For example, on ECDSA signatures, the byte order for r and s shall 
be big endian order.

shall_sentence:
A device that is not ready to accept a new request message shall respond with an ERROR 
response message with an ErrorCode of Busy (3h) (i.e., the device shall not silently discard 
the request message).
after_shall:
This requirement does not apply while a device is becoming ready to respond to SPDM 
requests after application of main power (see SPDM-11).

shall_sentence:
If a request is received out of order, then the device shall respond with an ERROR response 
message with an ErrorCode of RequestResynch (i.e., 43h) for that request and for all 
subsequent requests until a GET_VERSION command is received and processed (i.e., the 
device shall not silently discard requests due to an out of order request).

SPDM-20 
The device shall support at least two SPDM banks in order to support both a classical (e.g., 
RSA, ECDSA) certificate chain and a CNSA 2.0 compliant certificate chain (e.g., ML-DSA-87).

SPDM-21 
For form factors that support I3C, the device shall support SPDM-1 and SPDM-2 via MCTP 
over I3C.

The leaf certificate shall include a Subject Alternative Name certificate extension otherName 
field using the DMTF OID as defined in the Security Protocol and Data Model (SPDM) 
Specification with the following settings:

• 
the DMTF-serialNumber shall be set to same value reported in the Serial Number 
field of the Identify Controller data structure; 
• 
the DMTF-product shall be set to same value reported in the Model Number field of 
the Identify Controller data structure; and

• 
the DMTF-manufacturer shall be set to a value reported in the PCI Vendor ID field 
using the ASCII representation of the hexadecimal value without a leading “0x” or 
trailing “h”.

CERT-2 
The Root CA Trusted Certificate Authority shall be the device vendor and shall be the same 
across all device models developed by the device vendor.
The device shall support the AliasCert or DeviceCert model in slot 0.
after_shall:
An AliasCert in slot 0 is 
permitted while running regardless of which version of the SPDM Specification is negotiated 
(e.g., AliasCert in slot 0 is permitted running in SPDM 1.1 mode).

shall_sentence:
The AliasCert chain shall contain an immutable hardware identity certificate and hardware 
identity OID (refer to the SPDM Specification) shall be used to indicate hardware identity 
certificate(s).

CERT-6 
A Mutable certificate OID (refer to the SPDM Specification) shall be used to indicate mutable 
certificates.

The device shall be able to generate signed measurements (i.e., MEAS_CAP field shall be set 
to 10b) and shall support the following Measurement block types:

The device shall always return measurements of the most recently activated firmware and 
current configuration without requiring a power cycle or any type of NVMe or PCIe reset.
after_shall: Measurements of the activated firmware image are acceptable.

shall_sentence:
The device shall report the same measurements blocks and values for all devices in a 
product family (e.g., devices with the same model but different capacity points, endurance, 
or form factor).

The device vendor shall provide a Reference Integrity Manifest (RIM) for the firmware 
modules and configuration settings for components using the CoRIM schema as defined by 
IETF (refer to the latest version of draft-ietf-rats-corim - Concise Reference Integrity Manifest 
or the RFC (if any) published from that Internet-Draft).

If the CoRIM has reference measurements from sub-components 
from different manufacturers, then the reference values of the sub-components shall be 
captured in CoSWID tags with their individual signatures.
before_shall:
The reference measurements in the CoRIM schema may be expressed using the CoMID tags 
and/or the CoSWID tags.

shall_sentence:
The RIM shall apply to all devices in a product family (e.g., devices with the same model but 
different capacity points, endurance, or form factor).
after_shall:
The RIM shall not include any instance 
specific information (e.g., any device specific identifiers such as Serial Number, UUID, etc.).

shall_sentence:
The RIM shall not include any instance 
specific information (e.g., any device specific identifiers such as Serial Number, UUID, etc.).
before_shall:
The RIM shall apply to all devices in a product family (e.g., devices with the same model but 
different capacity points, endurance, or form factor).

shall_sentence:
The RIM shall be signed by the device manufacturer using the COSE schema (refer to RFC 
9052 - CBOR Object Signing and Encryption (COSE): Structures and Process (ietf.org) and RFC 
9053 - CBOR Object Signing and Encryption (COSE): Initial Algorithms (ietf.org)).
after_shall:
The device 
manufacturer shall use an approved digital signature algorithm (see SEC-48).

shall_sentence:
The device 
manufacturer shall use an approved digital signature algorithm (see SEC-48).
before_shall:
The RIM shall be signed by the device manufacturer using the COSE schema (refer to RFC 
9052 - CBOR Object Signing and Encryption (COSE): Structures and Process (ietf.org) and RFC 
9053 - CBOR Object Signing and Encryption (COSE): Initial Algorithms (ietf.org)).

shall_sentence:
The device manufacturer shall provide the customer with a digital certificate with the public 
key that is able to be used to verify the RIM signatures.
after_shall:
This digital certificate shall validate 
(e.g., via direct signature or certificate chain) to the Root CA Trusted Certificate Authority 
(see CERT-2).

shall_sentence:
This digital certificate shall validate 
(e.g., via direct signature or certificate chain) to the Root CA Trusted Certificate Authority 
(see CERT-2).
before_shall:
The device manufacturer shall provide the customer with a digital certificate with the public 
key that is able to be used to verify the RIM signatures.

shall_sentence:
The RIM shall contain the hash values of each firmware module using an approved hashing 
algorithm (see SEC-48).
after_shall:
ASCII text string values in the RIMs are acceptable if the string 
length is less than 128 bytes and the string is descriptive (e.g., a module identifier string, a 
product identifier string, or firmware revision string).

shall_sentence:
Devices that support TCG functionality (i.e., TCG devices) shall implement the specifications in accordance with 
the additional requirements in this section.

TCG devices shall support TCG Storage Security Subsystem Class: Opal Version 2.02, Revision 
1.0 or later, and all mandatory feature sets (e.g., Additional DataStore, Block SID 
Authentication, and PSID feature sets).
TCG-FEATURE-2 TCG devices shall support TCG Single User Mode feature set Version 1.00, Revision 2.00 or

TCG devices shall support TCG Configurable Locking for NVMe Namespaces and SCSI LUNs 
feature set Version 1.02, Revision 1.16 or later with mandatory support for the Namespace 
Global Range Locking object.
after_shall:
The Namespace Non-Global Range Locking object may be 
supported.

shall_sentence:
The current TCG feature set configuration settings, if any, shall persist through a download 
and activation of firmware code (e.g., TPer Lock State, Single User Mode configuration, no 
C_PIN Reset).
after_shall:
This is required regardless of the “default setting state” of the new code being 
downloaded.

shall_sentence: TCG-FEATURE-6 The device shall support the Data Removal Mechanism Feature Descriptor (Feature Code
The Data Removal Time Format bit shall be set to 0 to indicate the Data Removal

The Data Removal Time shall be less than or 
equal to 10 seconds per CTO-1.
before_shall: Time value is stored in (value x 2) seconds.

shall_sentence:
The device shall support at least 8 Additional DataStore Tables, each with a minimum size of 
128 KiB.
after_shall:
The required size of these tables is in addition to the 10 MiB minimum required for 
the DataStore Table.

shall_sentence:
The device shall support Shadow MBR functionality and shall disable that functionality by 
default in the MBRControl Table as specified by the TCG Opal SSC standard (see TCG-
FEATURE-1).

TCG-COMM-1 
The device shall support ComID management, and the Level 0 Discovery TPer Feature 
Descriptor shall report ComID Mgmt supported.

TCG-COMM-2 
The device shall support at least 2 Static ComIDs.

TCG-COMM-4 
MaxComIDTime shall be at least 120 seconds.
TCG-COMM-5  MaxComIDTime shall be greater than DefSessionTimeout.

A single Read-Write Session shall be supported per SP and shall be indicated by 
MaxSessions.
after_shall:
MaxSessions shall indicate the maximum number of simultaneous sessions 
supported (Read-Write + Read-Only).

shall_sentence:
MaxSessions shall indicate the maximum number of simultaneous sessions 
supported (Read-Write + Read-Only).
before_shall:
A single Read-Write Session shall be supported per SP and shall be indicated by 
MaxSessions.
after_shall:
It is not required to support an active RW session on 
the AdminSP at the same time as sessions on other SPs, because this would violate the TCG 
Storage Architecture Core Specification.

shall_sentence:
At least 2 Read-Only Sessions shall be supported per SP and shall be indicated by 
MaxReadSessions.
after_shall:
SET methods and other TCG commands that modify the TCG 
configuration state shall be rejected during a Read Only session.
key_phrases: SET methods and other TCG command

shall_sentence:
SET methods and other TCG commands that modify the TCG 
configuration state shall be rejected during a Read Only session.
before_shall:
At least 2 Read-Only Sessions shall be supported per SP and shall be indicated by 
MaxReadSessions.
key_phrases: SET methods and other TCG command

shall_sentence:
TCG-SES-3 
DefSessionTimeout shall be included in the Properties Method response from the device.

TCG-SES-4 
The DefSessionTimeout value shall be 90,000 ms.

TCG-SES-5 
The MaxSessionTimeout value shall be 0.
after_shall: This value indicates that there is no limit.

shall_sentence:
TCG-SES-7 
The SessionTimeout parameter of the StartSession method call shall be used to configure 
the session timeout.

TCG-TRAN-1 
TCG devices shall support TCG Transactions.

If TCG Nested Transactions are supported, all 
supported transactions including any nested transactions shall be reflected in the 
MaxTransactionLimit property.
before_shall: TCG Nested Transactions may be supported.

shall_sentence:
TCG-AUTH-1 
TCG devices shall enforce a minimum password length (C-PIN PinLength of 16) of 16 bytes 
for all TCG Opal authorities.

TCG-AUTH-2 
TCG devices shall allow a password length (C-PIN PinLength of 32) of at least 32 bytes for all 
TCG Opal authorities.
TCG devices shall set the default TryLimit to 10 for all TCG Opal authorities.
after_shall:
The value of the 
Tries column shall only be cleared to 0 for the mandatory reasons specified in the TCG 
Storage Architecture Core Specification (e.g., do not clear the Tries column via the Set 
method, do clear it upon successful authentication or power cycle).

shall_sentence:
The value of the 
Tries column shall only be cleared to 0 for the mandatory reasons specified in the TCG 
Storage Architecture Core Specification (e.g., do not clear the Tries column via the Set 
method, do clear it upon successful authentication or power cycle).
before_shall: TCG devices shall set the default TryLimit to 10 for all TCG Opal authorities.

shall_sentence:
Authentication of each C_PIN shall be delayed in order to limit how fast the next 
authentication of that C_PIN can occur.

• 
The delay shall be at least 100 ms and should not exceed 250 ms and I/O shall not be 
blocked during this time.
after_shall:
• 
The delay shall apply regardless of whether the authentication is successful.

shall_sentence:
• 
The delay shall apply regardless of whether the authentication is successful.
before_shall:
• 
The delay shall be at least 100 ms and should not exceed 250 ms and I/O shall not be 
blocked during this time.
after_shall:
• 
The device manufacturer shall supply documentation with the implemented delay 
value.

shall_sentence:
• 
The device manufacturer shall supply documentation with the implemented delay 
value.
before_shall:
• 
The delay shall apply regardless of whether the authentication is successful.
after_shall:
• 
The time limit should be enforced cryptographically (e.g., by tuning the number of 
PBKDF iterations to reach the target time).

shall_sentence:
TCG-AUTH-5 
The Persistence column shall be set to false for all C_PIN rows.

If TCG Opal Locking SP has been activated and the host has supplied at least one authority 
password, the device shall use at least one authority password as an added source of 
randomness for its Deterministic Random Number Generator (DRNG).
after_shall:
For example, the device may use KDF (PBKDF2) on the user provided locking range 
password to generate an output of equal length to the required locking range key length 
plus DRNG seed length.

shall_sentence: TCG-LOCKING-1 The number of Additional Locking Ranges supported shall be at least 8 and shall be greater
TCG-LOCKING-2 The Locking SP of the device shall support at least one User per Locking Range.
TCG-LOCKING-3 The K_AES_256 Table shall be supported.
TCG-LOCKING-4 The K_AES_256 Table’s Key columns shall not be readable by the host or be accessible
shall be rejected.
TCG-LOCKING-6 The Locking SP of the device shall support at least 4 Admins.
The PSID shall not be deterministic, shall comprise at least 160 bits of entropy.
after_shall:
The entropy 
shall be unique for each device.

shall_sentence:
The entropy 
shall be unique for each device.
before_shall: The PSID shall not be deterministic, shall comprise at least 160 bits of entropy.
after_shall:
The PSID shall not be derived from any information that is available without physical access 
to the device.

shall_sentence:
The PSID shall not be derived from any information that is available without physical access 
to the device.
before_shall:
The entropy 
shall be unique for each device.
after_shall:
For example, the PSID shall not be the same as the MSID, the PSID shall not be derived from 
the device serial number or the date of manufacture because these can be read via the 
device interface or obtained from other documentation.

shall_sentence:
For example, the PSID shall not be the same as the MSID, the PSID shall not be derived from 
the device serial number or the date of manufacture because these can be read via the 
device interface or obtained from other documentation.
before_shall:
The PSID shall not be derived from any information that is available without physical access 
to the device.
after_shall:
The PSID shall not be the serial 
number of the drive hashed with a secret string shared with any other device or among all 
devices, because the entropy shall be unique for each device.

shall_sentence:
The PSID shall not be the serial 
number of the drive hashed with a secret string shared with any other device or among all 
devices, because the entropy shall be unique for each device.
before_shall:
For example, the PSID shall not be the same as the MSID, the PSID shall not be derived from 
the device serial number or the date of manufacture because these can be read via the 
device interface or obtained from other documentation.
after_shall: The presence of the PSID on the device label does not violate this requirement.

shall_sentence: The PSID shall consist of 32 ASCII characters.
after_shall:
The allowed ASCII characters are upper case 
letters, lower case letters and the digits 0-9.

shall_sentence:
The characters ‘I’, ‘l’, ‘O’ and ’o’ (i.e., 49h, 6Ch, 
4Fh and 6Fh) and the digits ‘0’ and ‘1’ (i.e., 30h and 31h) shall not be used to limit possible 
visual confusion.
before_shall:
The allowed ASCII characters are upper case 
letters, lower case letters and the digits 0-9.

shall_sentence:
TCG-PSID-3 
The generation method for the PSID shall be documented and provided to the customer.

After the PSID is provisioned in manufacturing, the PSID shall not be persistently stored in a 
form that makes retrieval or reconstruction of the PSID by firmware possible, either on the 
drive or outside the drive (e.g., it is acceptable to store the PSID on the drive hashed via a 
cryptographic hash or KDF such that the hashed PSID can only be used to verify a PSID input 
from the host).
after_shall: The presence of the PSID on the device label does not violate this requirement.

shall_sentence:
The Model Number in Barcode-1, the Model Number printed on the label and the Model 
Number returned in Identify Controller Data Structure (CNS 01h, byte offset 63:24) shall all 
match unless exempted in writing by the customer.

The Serial Number in Barcode-1, the Serial Number printed on the label and the Serial 
Number returned in Identify Controller Data Structure (CNS 01h, byte offset 23:04) shall all 
match.

LABL-13 
The Hardware Revision printed on the label and returned by the nvme-cli utility shall match.

LABL-14 
All other electronically readable information shall also match their counterparts printed on 
the label.

If the surface of any component or casing will reach a temperature of 70°C (158°F) or 
greater the following warning logo shall be either printed on the label or placed separately 
on the device:

In addition, instructional safeguards shall be provided in accordance with IEC 62368-1 3rd 
Edition or later.

LABL-17 
The format of the Serial Number shall have no leading spaces (e.g., 1234567890123456).

LABL-18 
The Model Number shall have no leading spaces.

LABL-19 
Barcodes shall be printed using Datamatrix ECC200 or Model 2 QR code only.

LABL-20 
QR codes shall use a minimum of ECC Level M (15%).

LABL-21 
The density of the barcode shall be 10 mil or larger.

LABL-22 
The label shall only be printed on Polyester or Plastic labels using a Wax/Resin ribbon.

The PSID shall be printed on the label in its direct 32-character alphanumeric representation 
without any ancillary delimiting characters (e.g., underscore, dash, backslash, forward slash, 
etc.) and shall exactly match the readout of Barcode-2 (see the label example at the top of 
this section).

ROHS-1 
The vendor shall provide component-level reporting on the use of listed materials by 
concentration (ppm) for all homogenous materials.

ESD-1 
Device manufacturer shall provide ESD immunity level (HBM - Human Body Model) 
measured in accordance with IEC-61000-4-2.

EMC-1 
The device shall comply with the requirements of FCC / EN55032 Class B Radiated 
Emissions.

SUS-1 
A Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) aligned with ISO 14040 for the device shall be provided to the 
customer.

SUS-2 
Recycled content information per material type shall be provided to the customer.

The nvme-cli utility (https://github.com/linux-nvme/nvme-cli/tree/master/plugins/ocp) shall be used as one of 
the management utilities for NVMe devices.

MS-CONF-1 
M.2 and E1.S devices shall come from the factory with logical block size formatted per DP-
CFG-1 Configuration B, i.e., 512-byte sectors.

MS-CONF-2 
E1.L devices shall come from the factory with logical block size formatted per DP-CFG-1 
Configuration A, i.e., 4096-byte sectors.

MS-CONF-6 
For all devices, SMBus byte 91 bit 6, Firmware Update Enabled bit shall be set to 1b 
(Firmware Update is Enabled) by default from the factory.

shall_sentence: The Latency Timestamp time reported shall be based on CQ completion.
before_shall:
The Latency Timestamp allows an understanding of where a latency excursion occurred in 
terms of wall clock time.
after_shall:
If the device receives a Timestamp Set Features (Feature Identifier 0Eh), then the device shall use this baseline 
wall clock time plus the time in milliseconds since the Timestamp was set to determine the Latency Timestamp 
of the latency event.

shall_sentence:
If the device receives a Timestamp Set Features (Feature Identifier 0Eh), then the device shall use this baseline 
wall clock time plus the time in milliseconds since the Timestamp was set to determine the Latency Timestamp 
of the latency event.
before_shall: The Latency Timestamp time reported shall be based on CQ completion.
after_shall:
If the device receives multiple Timestamp Set Features (Feature Identifier 0Eh) the most 
recent Timestamp shall be used as the baseline.

shall_sentence:
If the device receives multiple Timestamp Set Features (Feature Identifier 0Eh) the most 
recent Timestamp shall be used as the baseline.

shall_sentence:
When either a safe or unsafe power transition happens the counters and associated Latency Monitoring 
Information shall be saved such that they can be restored on the next power up transition and continue from 
where the power cycle left off.
after_shall:
There are additional details about this in the C.5 Latency Monitoring Feature - 
Challenging Event Handling section.

shall_sentence:
The Debug Log Trigger Enable configures 
which counters shall trigger a debug log the first time the Bucket/Counter combination is incremented.
before_shall: The Latency Monitoring Feature can also enable debug logs to trigger.
after_shall:
Only a 
single debug log shall be generated.

shall_sentence:
Only a 
single debug log shall be generated.
before_shall:
The Debug Log Trigger Enable configures 
which counters shall trigger a debug log the first time the Bucket/Counter combination is incremented.
after_shall:
Once a Latency Monitor debug log is generated, until the Latency Monitor 
debug log is discarded another Latency Monitor debug log cannot be generated.

shall_sentence:
When the Latency Monitor debug log trigger event happens, the following data shall be captured:  Debug Log 
Measured Latency, Debug Log Latency Timestamp, Debug Log Trigger Source, Debug Log Timestamp Units, 
Debug Log Pointer as well as internal information required to debug the issue to root cause.
before_shall:
Thus, the Latency Monitor Feature will keep running undisturbed 
when the Debug Log is discarded.

shall_sentence:
When the Host Initiated Telemetry format supported bit is set to 1b then the format of the Latency Monitor shall 
follow the Host and Controller Initiated Log format.

Bucket Timer) may be slightly off due to concerns with flushing data with unsafe power down.

the Latency Monitoring Feature just as if a Set Features command to enable the feature was received.
